description: There is no better Double Margarita in the world. I think it's a quadruple, but who is complaining. After this Margarita I get brave to pay entire check. My favorite Mexican restaurant. Oh yea, the food is awesome as well! Love my Tia Margarita!!!
author: alex c.

description:
We got here for a late dinner yesterday. It was my friend's birthday and we were actually going to another place, but it turned out to be closed, so we looked for nearby places and found this one. 
The place closes at 9pm and it was 8:20pm when we got in. I totally understand that workers wanna go home on time, I've been there, but that's not a reason to be rude with customers... We really didn't feel like they were happy about seeing us. It was quite the opposite, actually. 
So it was a friend and I and we were expecting another friend to arrive. The hostess came and told us that the kitchen was closing in 5 minutes. Okaaaaaay.... I called my friend who was on his way and took his order through the phone. 
Now, something good about the place (actually worth 5 stars if it wasn't for other details: portions are HUGE. Literally. HUGE! I can't imagine that someone is able to eat all of a complete dinner. That's not  even possible. A friend had the tamales, I had enchiladas rancheras and my other friend had the pollo asado plate. Of course none of us could finish their dish. At 8:50 people were already staring at us like "get the hell out of here", but some of the people that were already in when we came in were still there, so what was the point? We ate super quick and asked for the check super quick, since we didn't feel welcome at all. 
When we left, there were like 10 people still in there, who were already there when we got in. So whatever. 
It's also a little pricey for a Mexican restaurant... But the portions are reasonable, so it's okay. 
Too bad the service wasn't nice to us, otherwise it would probably be a 5 stars for me.
author: Diana F.

description:
I was really looking forward to another excellent  meal since the food was delicious the first time. Sad to say, this time around the food and service weren't good. 

I ordered the small combination plate again with a chicken tamale, chile relleno, refried beans and rice all on one big platter. The beans weren't fully cooked and the tamale was bland. The relleno had a little more flavor, but that's not saying much. The best thing I had was the chile con queso appetizer. Melted cheddar cheese with chopped up green chillie's mixed in was heavenly! The cheese was so stringy every time I scooped some up with chips. Check out the photo! 

The service was slow and barely attended our table. We were the only large party and the server took forever to come to our table after we were seated. He wasn't too friendly either. The busser did most of the work by refilling our chips and salsa bowls, refilling our glasses with water, and clearing our plates. I don't think I'll be coming back for awhile.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
We came here this last Sunday night at about 8 and I got the Combination plate with a relleno, a tamale, and a flauta. It was a LOT of food. Like literally three mails. Honestly, their rice is not like spanish rice. I really didn't like the rice. It kinda seemed like frozen rice and not homemade. Their refried beans were just OK, kinda tasted to me like they just heated up old beans. But, they gave the option of black bean as well, which I appreciated. They were also conscious of our vegetarian diners, and were able to tell us that the rice was made in chicken broth, an important detail that we appreciated. 

All in all, service was slow, took a while, waiter was cool and laid back and got everything right, though.

We were seated immediately, but took 15 mins before we had waters or menus.

Reminiscent of Manuel's Mexican restaurant in Aptos.
author: William R.

description: If you're looking for a good margarita, this is not the place to go- watery and not like any margarita I've ever tasted. Very disappointing. The food was good but nothing special. The ambience and service were fine. If you're just going for food this is an okay choice but if you're looking to have a few drinks I would recommend you try another spot in the city.
author: Alex G.

description:
We came here around 4pm on a Sunday for an early dinner/late lunch. We were really in the mood for Mexican food and a friend mentioned that this place was good. 

Ambiance: Inside it was dim & clean. It looked super small when you walk in, but when we went to our table we saw how there was a lot more space toward the back of the restaurant. 

Service: Service was great here! We got seated right away- even though we came early. Chips were brought out immediately and waters as well. Our server was really nice and knew every thing about the menu- had a lot to suggest for vegetarian/ pescatarians.

Food: The food here was tasty and the plates were HUGE! We started with margaritas- they were pretty plain, but got the job done ;) They should put more lime juice in them for sure. I got a Tia Tostada with no meat and my boyfriend got enchiladas with shrimp for the filling. I tried a bite and the shrimp had such good flavor- they were rich in garlic, white wine, and butter and the outside enchilada sauce was to die for. The tostada was a little plain, I knew I should of gotten the shrimp tostada- NEXT TIME! 

For sure will be back! :) 4.5 stars!
author: Hayley D.

description:
If you're looking for an opinion on the food, read on. Booze? I'm no help.

What I can say, is that while they're not re-defining the bounds of Mexican food, you can find a classic Mexican restaurant menu here. You know the kind: enchiladas, burritos, tacos, chiles rellenos; the old reliables. You get a bunch of chips and salsa to your table, and one of them was a bit too hot for me, but it will burn your mouth in the best way. They don't want to be precious or fancy, they just want to be an old school neighborhood spot.

That's what they are: a neighborhood spot. On a Saturday evening in the neighborhood I noticed a lot of families coming in. Granted, it was early for dinner. Like, embarrassingly early. But they definitely had a full house by 6pm, and it wasn't rowdy, rather neighbors filing in. 

It's simple, they have a really great neon sign out front, and some old school booths as well as a dining area on the non-bar side of the building. the bar is a cool little wrap area, and they were stuffed to the gills with margarita glasses and limes. Even though I'm not a drinker, I can tell they do a serious business of margaritas. They have all the usual suspects on the menu, all the normal Mexican beers, and from the looks of the marg glasses, you can order a bunch and enjoy the night just fine.

I had a chimichanga and it was exactly as you'd expect. But it was well-made, simple, and didn't cost an arm and a leg. 

The comparison to Tommy's is inevitable, so I'll throw in my non-alcoholic two cents: I'd much rather eat here than there. The alco-philes can argue the maragaritas and tequilas all day without my input, but food wise it really was no contest. Neither is really meant to be just about the food, but I'd go here again for the big portions of Mexican food and the hustle of a Richmond neighborhood restaurant setting.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
A fun night out in a real neighborhood Mexican "joint" - there are a few rooms - I would have preferred to sit in the front Bar room (with a horseshoe shaped bar).

Very friendly service.

You don't see chimichangas on menus very often - so I went with it.  I think refried beans are the way to go (I got black beans, but tried the refried)

Drinks are strong.

($150 including tip for 4 people w/ cocktails)
author: Amy W.

description:
I am disappointed to write this review, but the extremely poor customer service we received this past Friday has lost Tia 4 local customers. 

We came in late Friday (8:30pm) for some drinks and apps (second dinner - a reoccurring Friday night for us) and were seated immediately. We were having a great time - each with top shelf double margaritas and enjoying two app orders. Mid-way through our time there, the waiter asked if we wanted anything else, and we said that we probably won't order more food, but will keep enjoying more drinks. The waiter responded in a pleasant manner (joking with us about going heavy on the drinks), offered to take our menus and left.

Right before getting the check, the host/manager (women with long brown hair) came over to our table to let us know that since we didn't order an entree - she would have to add $6/person to our bill. We've been to Tia multiple times with the same order - so this was new news to us. We politely pushed back, saying we had never heard this rule before - and she stated it's because it's a busy Friday night and she had other guests waiting for 45 minutes to eat dinner with entrees.

One - there was no line the entire time we were there, so I guess the person waiting for 45 minutes was invisible.
Two - there were empty tables in the restaurant so... not sure what's going on here (unless again... person was invisible so they sat without us knowing!)

We again push back, and she starts to get an attitude after some back and forth. So, in order to avoid a $24 incremental charge, we agree to order one entree. She leaves to get the waiter without a thank you or anything to try to smooth over the obvious negative interaction.

The waiter comes by with the menu, and we express our dissatisfaction with the situation. He decides to continue the poor customer service by trying to justify this "entree rule". When we ask if this rule is in writing anywhere, he points to the bottom of the menu - where it states that there will be a charge applied to the bill for splitting food. He then said "You split the appetizers - so this applies to you."

WHAT? The split charge vs. must order entree are completely different things, but now we're baffled. I'm sorry, we can't share appetizers? Who doesn't share appetizers? We stared at him incredulously, stated how ridiculous that was, but he remained firm.

In the end, we ordered the cheapest entree at $13. Our total bill pre-entree was already $115 - higher than the table sitting next to us that only ordered two entrees at $15/plate and no drinks. What is the business logic here? Also - if this really is a rule, please tell your customers BEFORE seating them in the dining area or tell them immediately once they've already mentioned mid-way through the meal that there were no more plans to order food.

I don't know what the manager was trying to prove - but from now on, I'm taking my business to local Tommy's Mexican, where we've never been treated so rudely or disrespected like we were at Tia.
author: Olivia W.

description:
I don't know the last time I've been to an actual sit down/serviced mexican place but this was worth it. Usually I'm a hole in the wall kinda person but I came for the double margs. and conquered all the delicious food.

This is my friend's go-to for some refreshing top shelf double margaritas (OH BABY). Came on a Sunday in the afternoon after some soccer and a couple of beers. We ordered a round of double margs and the queso appetizer which were perfect. The salsa they bring out is great, the mild is sweet and good for anyone, the spicy is def. a kicker--if you like a little spice, just mix the two, otherwise stick with the milk. Queso was ooey gooey and warm--magic in a dish to start soaking up those beers from earlier!

I ordered the Combination Plate 2 ($15.75) with Rellenos and Enchilada (Beef) and a side of refried beans, which I shared so I could score half of the Carne Asada Quesadillas ($13.75). Everything was great! I didn't think you could beat the whole in the wall comfort food of all the mission places but for what it was, this was really good. My combination plate was perfect, 10/10 would get it again. The Quesadilla was a not my favorite, since the tortilla was like fried super crispy--I think I would've preferred it to be like the super quesadillas you can get on every corner in the mission, and the portion was pretty small for the price but I guess if you weigh in the sides, it's alright. Overall, the rest of the plates seems to go over well anda decent portions once you tap in the sides. 

This stuff hit the spot and I felt better after eating it all--especially with the previous beers, def. soaked up some of that potential drinking aftermath.
author: Nerissa C.

description: LOVE Tia Margarita! I've been going there since I was 10 years old....I am now 60!!!! That's a long time to LOVE one place! Our home away from home! Fantastic food and drinks as ALWAYS! Thank you Jennifer Corwin for the generous and personal attention for my Brother Dales Birthday celebration last Wednesday night! As always, left Happy and FULL!! (And Dean LOVED the extra cherries!)
author: Karen M.

description:
Love Love Tia Margaritas!  The absolute best and delicious authentic Mexican fare!  The best Fresh home made Margaritas you will ever have! The bar tenders are so friendly and make you feel at home with exceptional service! I can't wait to go back! 


I've been back a few times to my favorite bar/ restaurant! Always an amazing time and friendly atmosphere. Love the authentic food & famous Margaritas! I always refer my guests here!  I hope to see you soon!
author: Rosemarie D.

description:
MarCan't talk much about the food yet, as typically I have eaten or I'm going to eat later. But definitely a great bar with good service and good drinks.

A properly executed Sunday starts with a double Top Shelf Margarita on the rocks with salt!
author: Rafael C.

description: Great food and massive portions. A plate can easily feed 2 hungry people and they constantly refill the chips and salsa. Much better food and service than Tommy's on Geary. Highly recommend the burrito plate.
author: Bobby B.

description:
Update: I'm tempted to give them an extra star as I find this place far more preferable to Tommy's (despite worse hours). If still give them 3 and a half though if I could and I end up rounding down since despite the decent food and great margaritas and salsa, I find them to be rather overpriced. 

I'll start by saying the following: if you want the best Mexican food in San Francisco, you should leave the Richmond. If you're like me and live in the neighborhood though, and want a place that is convenient, without the crazy lines of the best places in the Mission, and has great margaritas, Tia Margerita is a good option. 

The comparisons to Tommy's are inevitable since they are fairly close to one another and have similar menus and both are known for their margaritas. I think the margarita at Tia Margarita is far better, and I also enjoyed the chips and salsa here a lot more (I love the mild salsa; the spicy one is way too much for my tastebuds). 

The rest of the food is just okay- it's decent Mexican food, but certainly no where near the best I've had. I would also say the prices on their dinner menu are a bit higher than I would expect and want them to be (for the quality, quantity, and taste of the food). Personally, I would return here mostly for the margaritas (very very good) and the chips and salsa and maybe a shared appetizer or something. They also have a pretty big bar area, along with some tables near the bar and then another dining area with more tables. The atmosphere is enjoyable and the service is always pleasant and quite good. 

If I could, I would give them 3.25-3.5 stars with the extra decimal points mostly for their drinks and the service. Based on everything together though, I would say it's closer to 3 than 4 stars in my opinion.
author: Seema U.

description: Can be very difficult to find parking. Nice atmosphere. Good food & margaritas but overpriced. I recommend the Carne Asada.
author: Mrs G.

description:
Had reservations during the week to come here with coworkers. We have been looking for a place to enjoy good mexican food and drinks and heard that we needed to check this place out.

Walking in you definitely get the small town family feel. The whole place is very relaxed and and chill atmosphere with the bar in the front and more indoor seating in the back. The staff was very friendly throughout our stay, refilling drinks and keeping the chip bowl full. 

TIP: The portions are very large here, you get a lot for your money. Come here hungry or expect to take home leftovers.

The house margs were good, not the best I've ever had but a whole lot better than other places in SF. Our queso was a bit too stringy and we kept having to rip the strings to eat it, but the delicious flavor made up for the minor annoyance.

The friendly staff, good drinks, and the nice food made Tia Margarita Mexican Restaurant a great experience
author: Austin R.

description:
I haven't been here in at least 9 years and glad to see that it's still around. Established in '63. 

Food = good.

Guacamole = delicious. It's not a large portion for the price but worth it. $5.75** (Some reason they did not charge us for it...must've been because they were busy?!)

Tacos Dorados = two tacos (he chose ground beef, but you can have chicken or shredded beef); comes with salad, rice and beans (black or refried). $14.50

Combination (large, 3 items) = I couldn't decide so I went with this one against my stomach's capacity. Chile relleno (excellent with a to-die-for tomato- based sauce; so many years ago this place was my first chile relleno experience!), cheese enchilada (this wasn't my favorite item, because I'm not a fan of the flour tortilla and it was all I could taste. The cheese is mild and creamy.), beef taco (crispy shell, soft shell upon request; excellent tasting ground beef (shredded available, too) topped with guacamole and salsa. $17.75

Coke = $2.00

Service = friendly and pretty fast once you get a seat. There was a 30-minute wait on a Friday night but not a surprise. They have a handwritten list that they keep track of and yes, you should wait outside, or wait at the bar with drink in hand. FYI: Host desk is inside past the bar, which is hard to see when it's as packed as it was last night. 

Prices = reasonable to moderate. Dinner for two came out to $37.21. Took home leftovers for another meal. 

Noise = boisterous. I don't recall ever being here when it was"quiet" unless it was somewhat empty, which doesn't last for long.

Overall, still a solid place for well-portioned platters, great margaritas & other drinks (didn't imbibe this time but it was prevalent throughout the dining area and the large bar area). And they still have a light eater menu.
author: Fannie S.

description: Everything about the Tia is amazing.  From the outstanding margaritas to the delicious food!  The moment you walk in the door to the moment you leave the experience is full of fun relaxation and wonderful people!
author: Debra D.

description: The food was AMAZING !!! I have had my share of Mexican food but I must say this has been the best I EVER had. I had the Chef's Special which had steak, chicken and shrimp. Everything was seasoned to perfection. The steak was juicy and tender! The only thing that keeps me from giving this place 5 stars are the drinks. The drinks were overwhelmingly strong and not tasty at all. The frozen margarita was nothing but syrup and tequila. Couldn't even drink it. However, the food was AMAZING so all is well!
author: N F.

description:
Whoever gives this place a bad rating needs a spanking! When I lived in Outer Richmond this was my go to spot. Drinks are reasonable priced and the food is great every time. 

Make reservations! Call the restaurant leave a message and you're set. I always did this and had no problem getting a table. It gets packed on the weekends and it's not the biggest restaurant. Yes, the hostess the older woman is a little feisty but she's running the show alone and she's busy, who cares. 

Drinks are incredibly strong so don't drive to this place, take a cab LOL. The house margs are so simple yet the best I've ever had. Just stick with those you won't be sorry.

Food - being from Southern Cali I miss my Mexican food and this place hits the spot every single time. The enchiladas, refried beans, rice, guacamole, salsa, etc. Everything is tasty and big portions too! 

Great spot for any occasion even parties.
author: Mal L.

description: Been a couple of years since I went there. Hoping beyond hope things might have improved.  Haven't.  Same big margaritas -- same ghastly slop trying to pass for food. This is such a great space -- just wish like hell someone would buy this place and turn it into what it could be!
author: L M.

description: Needed a place close by home to grab dinner so I began searching and this place seemed like a good option. I'm glad they didn't prove me wrong! It was pretty busy that night, so getting a table would have taken about 25 minutes. We opted to sit at the bar where two spots had luckily just opened up. We both got a double margarita ($11.75) and it definitely packed a punch. For dinner, I got chicken tamales which were served with salad, rice and refried beans ($14). Oh, and their salsa is really good btw: there's one mild and one spicy! The food is bomb and the portions are huge so we exercised self control and took the rest home. The bartenders were friendly and service was fast. I'll definitely be back here again and will bring my friends!
author: Pooja C.

description: Every time I've come here, they've been closed. Once they were gone for Christmas, which I understand. But today, a day they're supposed to be open, they're closed. Ridiculous.
author: David S.

description: All around good. Not great. But ok. Large portions. Extra salty. Lacking big flavor or anything to remember. Drinks also are good not great. Local neighborhood crowd and busy but friendly staff.
author: Jay D.

description:
They're margarita s are great here and you might as well double them. 
Their chicken wings are to die fire and so are their empanadas.
author: Miguel E.

description: Atmosphere is nice and servers friendly. The food I would say was a couple steps up from Taco Bell. Very bland and non traditional. Empanadas were good but I wouldn't call them that, also I regretted ordering them with the quesadilla as my meal was just all cheese.
author: Hoku L.

description:
This is an Outer Richmond gem. Bar is always packed with locals. Walk further in and around the bar to get a seat. You'll see almost every person with a margarita in front of them. You can have it blended or on the rocks (with salt if you like). On a hot day, their ice cold double margarita is best blended.. the best adult slushie in the nieghborhood!

Huge portions and their menu has everything you've ever craved for. Everything is so good. I need the recipe for their complimentary salsas, especially the hot one. The chile relleno is my usual order now but the fajitas and enchiladas are total comfort food too.
author: Samantha L.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and I come from the margaritas, stay for the food.

The margaritas are exceptional, especially if you're into strong drinks. They do not hold back on the tequila and you can tell when you take the first sip. The food isn't exquisite, but it's definitely enough to keep you coming back. My go-to's are the Chorizo con Huevos and the Guatemalan Tostada (can't get enough of the latter!).

Also, the service at the bar is top-notch. Super friendly even at their busiest.
author: Lucas B.

description:
Chimichunga was good but the empanadas were like something you'd get from the frozen food section.

Cool bar and interior though.
author: Sarah S.

description: Margaritas are weak here. I can't believe i fell for the top shelf gimmick too, it wasnt any better than a regular margarita, it was more like a low shelf margarita. I was craving a good margarita too and was so disappointed. The food here is middling - I got chicken enchiladas with red sauce and black beans and rice. I was really hungry and the portion of food was good enough to tie me over for the rest of the night, maybe because I ate a lot of the tortilla chips they are the best thing here. The service and food were closer to a 3 but wish they stepped up their margarita game.
author: Matt D.

description:
The perfect place if you have young children, love margaritas and need to get out of the house. 

Arrive at 4:30pm with your young kids and get excited. The friendly staff will put you in the back room with all the other families and it's awesome. 

Worried your 18 m/o will start screaming? No worries, there's a poorly behaved 3 y/o at the next table! It's like a Mexican Chuck e Cheese minus the play structure and WITH alcohol. Order a minimum of two double margaritas and your spouse will become more attractive and your kids will get cuter. 

As for the food? Keep expectations low and focus on that it's a meal you didn't have to shop for, cook or clean up after. That's a win folks.
author: Alison C.

description: Sitting here trying to think about my favorite part of this meal... Unfortunately, I can't come up with anything. This is probably the worst Mexican food I've ever had. Everything is bland, from the salsas at the beginning to the chicken chile verde enchilada dish I ordered. Plus the service stinks. Don't waste your time here. You're in San Francisco, go eat Mexican food at one of the many delicious restaurants around the city.
author: Adriana G.

description: This is a great, low key restaurant. Fantastic service and an environment that makes you feel like you are eating in an authentic neighborhood restaurant. Great service and tasty food--hard to go wrong. The "small combo" is huge and delicious!
author: Joe G.

description:
As I sat down for dinner on my first visit to Tia Margarita this evening I overheard the couple sitting next to me complain to the bartender that they had been charged for double Margaritas and had not ordered them. I had just ordered a Margarita w/ salt prior to hearing this. The couple left rather unhappy.  I drank my Margarita ( less than noteworthy) and finished my dinner ( quite good ), I then got the check. I too had been charged for a double Margarita. I insisted that I had not ordered nor been asked about a double. The bartender and his coworker were adamant that I had been asked if I wanted a double. They then reluctantly (yet rather quickly) removed the charge from my tab while muttering I won't mentionables in Spanish. 

You can't knock Jay-Z's hustle but I'm knocking yours Tia Margarita. Your hustle is whack. 

First time customer now last time diner at Tia Margahustlers.

P.S. Tia Margarita bar staff, your customers just may speak Spanish when you think they don't. 

Cheers to the cooks, they did their job, but the FOTH can suck it for attempting this bs hustle on a hospitality veteran. 
 
1 star.
author: Nick W.

description: What's wrong with the food at Tia Margarita's?  It's SLOP, not fit for a trough!  Typical Mexican restaurant microwaved soup (refried beans), tasteless rice, and some shredded lettuce.  The cheese enchiladas were stuffed thick with some foreign kind of salty cheese then smothered with some orange-colored paste (their enchilada sauce).  My tamale was a gigantic, cold lump of off-colored corn meal about 2-3 inches thick and I could barely find the meat.  (Sent it back for another cheese enchilada -- big mistake!)  The tamale had its own horrible sauce, too.  I can't describe what they called a chile relleno --some greasy, soggy pancake that had a chile in it somewhere.  Horrible!  About an hour after eating, I was so bloated -- like I swallowed a salt lick -- it was unbelievable.  I suffered from severe gas all night long and the next morning, then suffered from constipation for the next full day.  The margaritas were delicious, however.  Go there (if you can ever find a parking place) only for a couple margaritas, friendly bartenders, and some chips and salsa but pass on any food!
author: Larry H.

description: I am not sure on what planet bartenders consider it ok to look at their tip and shame their customers with dirty looks and cuss words. Pedro, get it together, you always have a bad attitude, Margaritas you make suck and you don't ever make me or my friends feel welcome. You should be happy with the 15% you got.
author: Anne L.

description: I have found Tex-Mex in SF!  My god have we been looking for this place, if you are from Texas and miss Tex-Mex, come here.
author: Ryan R.

description: This place is the worst we showed up on a Friday no room at the bar or in the front dining. The rude lady at the front seats our party in the back by the bar window. The servers were horrible to us, you'd think they didn't want a tip. They treated us like we sat ourselves in their way. The amount of rudeness out of our server when taking our order, the food sucked and the drinks were not all that. Each of us there and there were at least 8 of us will never come back there again nor ever recommend this place to our friends or Family. If your looking for authentic and friendly and good margaritas go to PUERTO ALLEGRE in the Mission instead. Zero stars is on purpose for this joint.
author: Danielle D.

description: the service was spotty but the food was plentiful and tasty...a nice change from a taqueria
author: Wendy X.

description:
A Margarita Bar with Attitude?
Save yourself the hassle and go to Tommy's. 

Tia has become the trendy hip  place for the rich community that surrounds the restaurant. Go here if you want to mingle with 50 somethings looking to get drunk on margaritas and uppity old man bachelors looking to impress a date with overpriced margaritas. Outside of the margaritas, there is nothing memorable or special about this restaurant; for most, it's the closest Mexican restaurant in 6 blocks, and as such it's last man standing. Don't get any illusion that the food at Tia's is beyond average.  Generous portions of bland rice and beans don't make an $18 combo plate any better tasting. 

I live in the surrounding neighborhood and walk to Tia's. The bartenders and servers always give attitude and poor service. The tiny restaurant lounge fills when 10 people show up and there is nothing special about the decor. The bill is always a bit puzzling as the bartenders seem to make up the prices and charge whatever they want (4 margaritas = $62?). When they get lazy, they serve margaritas in beer glasses but they always give a smile when they give you attitude. Basically, it's the well known situation that the manager and head bartender has been there 19 years, does whatever he wants, and doesn't care. Two years ago, the restaurant was on the verge of closing because of his attitude and today it's popular because the 50 somethings think margaritas are cool again. In 2 years it will cycle back.

Skip the noise and go to Tommy's on Geary with amazing margaritas, a super long list of tequilas and 10 times better service. Tommy's is where the locals in the Richmond go. The margaritas are better, the food is much better and the family owned business atmosphere is fun. 



Food = mediocre.
Maragaritas = good
Service = poor
Price = poor.
author: Jay T.

description:
The roommate was craving Mexican food. Enchiladas to be exact. We decided to pick up Tia Margarita on the way home. I called to place the order when he picked me up downtown. The order was ready about 10 minutes after we arrive.

*Chips and Salsas
If we ate here, they would have given us chips and salsa, so I'm happy they were nice enough to pack some. There's two different salsa. One is spicy and packs a kick! My mouth actually felt like it was on fire towards the end of our meal. I wasn't expecting that. Mixing the two makes for a good balance.

All orders are served with rice, salad and your choice of refried or black beans (we got refried beans with everything):

*Chef's special combo ($22.75): One third each - Carne asada, Pollo asada, Gambas
This was my order. The shrimp were garlicky and buttery. The chicken had a good char and flavor. The steak was slightly tough, but still good. You can ask for corn or flour tortillas with this plate.

*Enchiladas (2) $13.75: corn tortillas rolled around shredded beef and covered with a mild red chili sauce and melted jack cheese
The roommate's. He didn't like this as the sauce was way too thick. Had the consistency of a lighter peanut butter which just tasted weird.

*Chimichanga (1) $13.25: crisp large flour tortilla rolled around chicken and rice with guacamole (no sour cream)
It's kind of bland with just the rice and chicken filling. Super oily as well.

I'd say the food deserves about 3 stars, but the server taking care of me was super nice! Asked me if I wanted more salsa, utensils and napkins, etc. Most places wouldn't care when it comes to take out orders. But the server that helped me out bumped this review up to 4 stars!
author: Elena N.

description: Yummy margaritas and that melty cheesy goodness that Mexican food is supposed to be, but flavors could be better/prevalent
author: Aletta A.

description:
If you are looking for that old school Mexican American restaurant that serves enchiladas smothered in sauce and cheese on a heated plate, this is it.  Tia Margarita reminded me of the Mexican food I grew up with. I have no idea if it's authentic but who cares. It tastes good and the margaritas are top notch!

I had a small combo plate of shredded chicken enchilada and chile relleno which came with yummy refried beans, rice and that shredded iceberg lettuce that no one ever eats. Very tasty and totally hit the spot. 

Definitely worth stopping by if you are in the area!
author: Ada C.

description: Great service. Awesome Margaritas.. man seems expensive but NOT. you get what you pay for. wonderful experience. keep it up!
author: Jorydude r.

description:
Went to this place for a friend of a friend's birthday dinner. First thing I noticed was the building itself, reminds me of a saloon like entryway, like Luca Brasi is going to meet with the Tataglia family in Godfather Part I. 

There are certain things you can expect from Mexican cuisine establishments, but there were two things that this place was lacking; loud fiesta-like music, but more importantly, hispanic patrons. For me, being part Latino, it's something I've come to expect when I go eat Mexican food. That being said, the dining experience wasn't horrible.

The servers were friendly and attentive, and the portions are quite generous. I shared the chef's special combo, which comes with beef, chicken, and shrimp with rice and beans. The rice isn't you're typical "spanish rice" and they only offer black beans or re-fried beans (I'm a pinto/whole bean kind of guy). I will say that the shrimp was SPECTACULAR, but that was the only thing that really stood out to me from meal.

All in all, if you're of latino decent/upbringing, you're probably not going to be a huge fan of this place. BUT, the silver lining is that the portions are big and the shrimp is on point.
author: Aaron C.

description:
food was solid, especially after a long hike. the ambiance is different than i'm used to, full of families with children. the spicy salsa was really good (actually SPICY). 

portions are huge and definitely had enough to eat for lunch the next day.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Oh, Tia Margarita,
I used to love you.
But the last few times...
not so much.

I know you're an SF native joint.
I know you're old school style Mexican.
I know you're a classic.
I know you're neighborhood.

You're very generous.  My steak was practically as big as the plate!  Yes, you've certainly induced countless food comas over the years.

But huge portions don't mask mediocrity.  Too much of a bad thing is not a good thing.

Your basics are strong.  Love your salsa, rice & beans.  But entrees are hit or miss.  Your chicken enchiladas used to be great.  Not dry & bland. 

Same goes for your tacos.  But, donde esta el sabor?

Que Paso?

You do make a mean margarita.  I think they're the best thing about you.

Your service is nice.  Sometimes slow, but always nice.  

If only the last couple of times the stench of cleaning fluid or insect repellant wasn't so strong.  It's most unsavory.  Especially for dining.

You're still an institution in SF...

I may have to love you less, but I won't leave you.  

3 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
With deep disappointment, I need to write an unfavorable review. I've been going to Tia for many years. This has nothing to do with the food or staff. 

This restaurant now imposes a 2 credit card limit for their dining tables. Really? I've been coming here for years. If I sit at the bar with 2 friends - no problem.  We can each legitimately pay for our drinks and meal. But, at a table with my 2 best friends? Sorry. Two people only get to pay. I'm so mortified for having to ask the wait staff for an exception, or ask one of my friends to buy my dinner. We are all three professionals. We work hard and choose to spend our money at that this local restaurant. 

I've witnessed this restaurant being very accommodating to families. Children running around the restaurant...I've even seen a parent changing a dirty diaper at the table. Gross. Have I ever complained? Nope. Love this vibe of this neighborhood place. But, I'm now getting shamed because I'm not a couple or a family? I'm not respected as a valuable customer? I'm not getting the basic standard of service in San Francisco? Nearly every restaurant accommodates this common payment method. 

I hate getting upset at a family business. I tried to give my feedback to the manager/owner tonight, but she could not even respect me enough to look me in the eye. Instead, she sat in her desk/box, and processed credit cards while I attempted to explain my dissatisfaction. It was supremely disappointing. I ended up waking away. 

I feel strongly about calmly and authentically voicing my opinions about my experience to a business representative, and expect to be heard. If not, then it is my obligation to respond by simply withdrawing my business. So, perhaps that is the next step. Is this really what they want? Do they care about their regular customers? I'm leaving this an open question for now. 

I hope there is some acknowledgment and change in this policy. I have been an advocate for this business, and would prefer to continue to do so. But, beware to any customers that are with more than one friend - bring cash, or get ready to ask for somebody in your group to pay your bill. Silly. Outdated. Unfriendly. Unnecessary.
author: Jeannine L.

description: Was turned away because they said they were too busy with more than an hour to go before they close. Used to live coming to this place but the rudeness and lack of customer service has really made me think twice about continuing to give this place my business. I would recommend going to to Tommy's Mexican on geary
author: John F.

description: I love Tia! I always sit at the bar and order food. The Margaritas are STRONG, the bartenders are friendly and the portions for food are huge. Get the refried beans.
author: sophia f.

description:
Alright food. Great waitress. Good time

Me and my family were in the area looking for good mexican food. We came across this.

Food is pretty expensive and isnt even 'authentic'. Im mexican and know authentic mexican food as compared to a burrito or refried beans with cheese. I got the combo platter which is a shit ton of food for 18 bucks. The waitress we had named Rosa was a real character. We spoke spanish to her and she said she was Guatemalan. She didnt know too much about real Chiles Rellenos. Its expected. No problem. She was too funny unconsciencely. In the end she caught me textin me and scolded me for not being with my family even tho we were done and waiting for the check. She took my phone and took a picture hahaha. We didnt ask for it but she did.
author: Aldo A.

description:
So happy this neighborhood gem is just a short stumble away from home. The atmosphere is always lively and fun. The margaritas are yummy and pack a punch - enough to make you feel all warm and fuzzy inside on a foggy, damp evening.

The food is typical Mexican American fare - huge portions laden with melted cheese. It's diet busting guilty conscience good, but far from authentic taqueria style, so leave those expectations at the door.

Sidle up to the bar and leave with a smile plastered all over your tequila-salted pucker.
author: Carole B.

description:
Pros: Decent atmosphere and easy to get in.

Cons: Margaritas are disappointing and the food is mediocre at best. They do give you a lot of food but it all taste exactly the same. I need a cup of salsa to give it any real flavor.  I left half my plate the last time I went.
author: Chris S.

description: First time we tried  their food and we are disappointed.  The food was  not good. Tamales was a little bit hard.
author: Conrado A.

description:
Review on: combination plate which consisted of cheese enchilada, chicken taco, rice & black beans. 

1.) The chicken in my "Taco Bell" shell it came in, was super dry and needed salt. 
2.) The enchilada sauce was nothing special. Plus, the tortilla was still semi hard.
3.) Rice was good.
4.) Black beans were okayish.

On the plus side, they do give you a nice big serving, on a huge plate. My food LOOKED good but unfortunately was not. 

I really want to give this restaurant another chance and perhaps order something else. But from experience, it seems as though, if this restaurant can't even get the most basic dishes taste good, what makes me think that their other dishes would be any better.
author: Worldwide ..

description:
Start with their double margarita!  It's nice and strong!

Been here 3 or 4 times, never a bad meal.  Their complimentary salsa is spicy hot!  I tasted hints of ghost chili...I like!

On my latest visit, had their prawns sautéed in garlic, butter and wine.  Delicious!!  I could eat another order!

This place has been around for years and will continue to dine here whenever I'm in the neighborhood.
author: The Q.

description: For what it is, this place is awesome.   The atmosphere was lively and fun.   Chips and salsa to start.   Habanero salsa is delicious.   Combo plate: chile relleno, taco and enchilada.  All three were above average.  Refried beans and rice were great.   This place might not win a Michelin star but I'd definitely come back and am very happy it is close to my neighborhood.
author: D B.

description:
we were @ tia margarita last nite! (1-06-17-friday) the hostess  who claims 2b the owner who was rude 2my party & I was confrontational with me!
we left !
would not recommend this restaurant!
just move on!!
author: Yvonne F.

description:
We recently were able to get to Tia Margarita's, after a too long absence, due to my husband's serious health issues. 
It was wonderful in all aspects, and it was just like coming home again, and great to see Helen, co-owner and Hostess, on last Sunday.
The traffic, getting there, was of course, it's usual Bay Bridge mess, but all this inconvenience was certainly worth it.
As long as we have been going there, and love the foods we always order, the Carne Asada, was absolutely perfect and the best I have ever tasted. The same goes for the Gambas Appetizer, and the take home order of Chile Rellenos, another favorite dish. 
It was a great delayed , joint Birthday celebration for the two of us, and if Mark's health, continues to improve,  we will surely return, after the New Year. The ride going back home to the Rockridge district in Oakland, was also the best it has been in years, and no delays getting home.
All in all, it certainly was a wonderful day! Well spent,by us , and a great reunion.
Thank you again ,Tia Margarita and Helen, for everything, and have a really wonderful Christmas vacation, and a very Happy New Year, as well.
We will see you all again, next year!!
author: Cheryl W.

description: I resisted the other bad reviews because this is a neighborhood spot, but now I know. The server was drunk, the bartender was the rudest person ive ever encountered (sir, your margarita was terrible. Yes I asked for extra lime juice and when you mocked me for asking in a nice way, we should have left then. You're the worst). The food was a step above Taco Bell. The plates had been sitting in the window because the plates were hot and the beans crusty (yes I've worked in a restaurant before too and know how that goes). Go to Tommy's.
author: Molly W.

description: Great salsas and chips while you wait. Prompt as hell service. Food was excellent just what one expects kind of a "Americanized" Mexican food which is sometimes just what the doctor ordered. My tacos were great. High quality ingredients not at all greasy or lardy. Awesome warm local feeling atmosphere inside the place. Looks like people at the bar or families at tables were all happy and all fine in the same environment. Will def be back!
author: Jason P.

description:
All I can say from the beginning, San Fransisco does not know how to do Mexican Food, especially this establishment.  Situated in a neighborhood where parking is impossible and you need to bay $8 to park just to eat starts you off in a bad mood.

The salsa for the chips have a ketchup y taste to it.  They need to ditch it and use the Pico De Gallo that is used on their black beans as that combination was one of the best I have ever heard.

The orders were late, the orders came out wrong, the service was very long and it is incredibly loud.  I believe people go there for the booze as they were giving very small shots of Tequila to get the mood going.

The fajitas were nothing more than pieces of steak and chicken basically stir fried at best.  The Cheese Enchiladas came with Chicken and no tortillas nor black beans were served as ordered, only re-fried beans.  

That being said, the QC is terrible, the menu should really be tasted with someone with authentic Hispanic culinary skills behind them.  

Lastly, the service was abysmal.  The only reason I do not give this establishment one star, is that the black beans with the pico de gallo were to die for and I would highly recommend that to everyone!
author: Larry H.

description:
This is the kind of 1970's mexican place you don't see much of anymore, with a pleasant, lively vibe, kind and attentive servers, giant plates covered in starch, cheese and iceberg lettuce, and understated but charming decor.  I don't expect much from the food at a place like this, but I found my dish, enchiladas rancheras, to be delicious.  I enjoyed my margarita too, but my friend was disappointed to find out he had been given a Double when he didn't specify the size he wanted.  It sounds like if you order a margarita it's on you to specify Single, otherwise the default order placed is for the Double.  :\

Tia Margarita's reminds me of Trevino's in El Cerrito.  Same kind of old-school vibe, strong drinks, plates covered in carbs and dairy, plus they have a parking lot!
author: Susan B.

description: Fresh food and very friendly service with a cozy, old school Mexican vibe. Eager to go back!
author: Julie R.

description:
Abuela is cute. to. death. The scripted English order-taking, the over-politeness, the constant breaking of our table conversation to ask if we wanted stuff, the bringing my friend someone else's order, the getting my order wrong, the hearing aid(?), the limp... instantly endearing. How could anyone not want to give her a big hug every time she materializes tableside?

Funny thing is, a good bit of our server's charm would've been decidedly not cute had it been from anyone else (including my actual abuela).

Four of us had tamales, enchiladas x 2, tacos, and beverages for a total of $80-something before tip. More of a Mexican Applebee's than a Mission satellite. Sans barefoot wannabe hipsters, too. I still don't know how the dude from Oaxaqueña bore pedaling with just his feet when I saw him fixie-ing around later on.
author: Dan B.

description:
Great Margaritas... the chef specials are awesome.  The spice on the carne asada, pollo y gambas (shrimp) is incredible.  Go with the chef special combo for sure, you won't regret it.

Great friendly, local bar crowd.  This place is a nice locally known gem.  Been around for decades, family owned.  Great staff.  Eat here, support this great local business.
author: T. E.

description:
Ok I'll start with the good- the margaritas are delish, they really are. The chips and salsa are quite good as well. The food is your classic middle America overly greasy Mexican food. Maybe a little better then that. 

The less good- the front room of the place is fun to be in, with its round bar and stained glass windows and booths, but the back room-which they always want to stick you in- us yucky, dark old carpet, musty and depressing. 

The worst- I made a reservation for a family bday dinner - super early (5:30) because we had 2 babies in the party. Specified that we wanted the front room because the back stinks. When we got there-- the hostess was super inappropriate and rude, made a simple situation hard, and we ended up leaving, schlepping 2 cars, with babies, to find somewhere else to eat. 

Anyway. I just wish they'd renovate the back, and loose the family member, unprofessional help. Now I feel like I can't even go get a margarita.
author: jessica h.

description: Came here with my hubby for dinner tonight and everything was delicious! I ordered a double margarita, it was delicious and strong! We ordered the sampler as an appetizer and both picked combination plates. I ordered the chili relleno, cheese enchilada and chicken flauta. The portions were huge and everything was absolutely perfect. The service was quick and friendly too. Tia Margarita was a random food find, but is a new favorite for us. We will definitley be back soon!
author: Michelle A.

description:
Dinner was excellent tonite!  The guacamole was delicious but pricey.  The chips were freshly fried.  They were warm when they got to the table.  The salsas were delicious.  The rice and beans were excellent too.  We had the fajitas, the gambas, the chiles rellenos, the burritos, the enchiladas, etc and it was all excellent.  

OUR WAITER WAS THE BEST!

I've been there in the past and thought the food was meh!  But today it was excellent!  I will definitely go back while they have this chef.  

The Sangrias and Margaritas were excellent, too!

The hostess had it together, too!

Don't change a thing for a long time, please!
author: Emilia G.

description:
What can I say about Tia's that has not already been said? Great handmade margs by the friendliest bartender in town! It is truly a neighborhood favorite where everybody knows your name. But having said that everyone is made to feel welcome as if you had been coming there for years. 
Is the food the best Mexican you will ever have, no. But I am not entirely sure that is what the draw is.  For me, it is a great place to go to gather for drinks with friends and have some appetizers because I think they do that VERY well. Everyone is friendly and welcoming. It's a great place to spend an evening.
author: Denise B.

description:
Food: 1 star
Service: 2 stars
Margaritas: 3 stars

The food here is TERRIBLE, just about the worst I've had. People definitely come here for the margaritas. The bartender is okay but frequently appears like he's tired of waiting on you and doesn't return so you can order another round. That's the whole point of sitting at the bar. They are also very stingy with their chips and salsa. The bartender gets irritated if you ask for a refill on chips, even though the bowls are tiny for a big group of people. The margaritas are okay but overpriced and disappointing that there is no kind of happy hour for them.
author: Amelia E.

description: This past Friday was my first time at Tia Margaritas and definitely my last. A group of 7 of us went out to celebrate a friends graduation and this place was recommended for their well raved about margaritas and large combination plates. We waited about 30 minutes for a table and ordered several drinks at the bar. Once we were seated, we were greeted with Salsa and chips -- very tasty. It was when our server was informed that not everyone would be eating was when our experience took a dive for the worst. He immediately snapped and asked us if our party had informed the host that not everyone would be ordering an entree. I've been in the restaurant business for many years and was absolutely appalled when he started giving us a major attitude for this. There was at least $60 of alcohol at the table and 4 of the 7 of us ordered food. I still can't see the issue. They took our chips away as if we came there to camp on waters and free salsa. They not once came over to refill waters and pointed at us and laughed at us. It was the epitome of a bizarre experience and  when a member from our party addressed the manager she finally came over and slammed 2 waters on the table and snickered! The worst part, they added extra charges to our bill, like $6 split charges and drinks we didn't order. They also "accidentally" charged our card $9 extra for no reason! Avoid this place at all costs, it was a nightmare and the customer service was unlike anything I've ever witnessed. This place deserves nobody's business for the way they treat people! A bunch of thieves in my humble opinion. Big ups to the bar we went to afterwards for the amazing costumer service and strong drinks to help us forget about this dump of a restaurant.
author: Alexandra S.

description: I came here with a group of friends for the good food but instead encountered terrible service. We waited an hour for a table of 7, and when 4 of us ordered(to share) our server asked us if we told the host only some of us were eating. This is a prime example of what NOT to say to customers, especially since we all ordered drinks that came out to more than an average dish. The server was clearly only motivated by tips, and never checked on our table after we ordered our food which he deemed unacceptable to the size of our party. If you're a server, here's a tip: don't make your guests feel unwelcome solely due to the size of their order. You never know who will tip well, and when you approach customers with a bad attitude you're only making that fact.
author: Chase M.

description: My girlfriend always passed this place and thought this was the "poppin'" place to be! Me not being a huge fan of Mexican food I was a bit hesitant but we went and at first I thought, "okay fine..." I was pleasantly surprised. I would recommend the quesdilla and the enchiladas. I'm more partial to the quesdilla myself, though the gf prefers the enchilada. What really impressed me was the service. Almost the moment I finished the salsa they replaced the salsa and refilled the chips  (chips and salsa are complementary btw). That's really what prompted this review was that simple little event. My only complaint is there is a split entree charge so just be aware of that. All in all, I was impressed considering I eat mexican food once a year at most lol
author: Wil S.

description:
We have come back a few times since the bad experience previously and have had better service. We walked in around 8:30pm on a Friday and it was busy as usual! The hostess said 30 minute wait, totally understandable. So we ordered drinks at the bar with Francisco before our table was ready. The hostess really stepped up her game (or the people ahead of us walked out) because a table was freed up in the bar after about 10 minutes.

I had gallbladder surgery recently and was worried if I'd be able to find anything to stomach on the menu. I ordered the "light eater" plate - MUCH smaller than those huge combo plates - one chicken enchilada with red sauce (no cheese or sour cream) which came with black beans, rice, and salad. It was the perfect portion and didn't make me sick! Yay! I also had to watch myself with their tasty chips and salsa; very easy to go overboard with those. Everything tasted fresh and flavorful. 

My boyfriend, card-carrying member of the clean plate club, wolfed down his carne asada enchilada combo plate in no time. My friend really enjoyed her shredded beef chimichanga combo plate too. Full bellies and content tastebuds all around.
author: Liz G.

description: Moved to the bay area in 79 from Chicago when i was married. We found this place in  a restaurant book on bay area places to visit and eat.Great atmosphere food and drinks by Francisco. Last time i ate there was in 2014  . Francisco was still there behind the bar.He had not aged at all. I am in South Florida now. But ill be back next week and plan on taking another stop there.
author: Ron B.

description:
"What the f*^$ was that?!" Pretty much the only thing I could say after eating here. Sure as hell isn't very good I can you that much. I've had plain white rice with more flavor than any of their dishes. More love was put into the concept of the movie Gigli then these dishes. Yes the margaritas as strong but it doesn't make them good. Seriously they serve rice pilaf here instead of the traditional. My head almost exploded. 1 star, well because I have to at least, but for their friendly staff.

What we had - steak fajitas, enchiladas, tamales, all with rice and beans

I will continue to have nightmares about this place like I was in 'Nam.
author: Chris D.

description:
This place is walking distance from home so I really tried to to like it but I've been disappointed time after time. 

The margaritas and staff are great so I'll give them 1 star. 

The food is disgusting and taste like the majority is either frozen or canned. They don't even serve traditional Mexican rice!! Thai visit I got the flautas and my bf got the nachos. The flautas were drowning in sour cream and the chicken had no flavor at all. The nachos were both burned and soggy. Looked as if they sat under a hot lamp too long after being made. 

Sorry guys. I really wanted to like you guys. I love Mexican food and wanted a decent place by my home. =\
author: Paty O.

description: So, the food here isn't exactly great. Customer service is hit-or-miss. Drinks are the real reason why you come here because the margaritas are pretty damn strong, and they're not expensive either. The food is actually not great here. I mean, it's a Mexican place in the outer Richmond, so I"m not exactly expecting some great Mexican food, but I expect more than just some scattered refried beans topped with jack cheese and a smattering of iceberg lettuce to go on my taco. I want a legitimate taco, and what is with this ground beef business? That isn't exactly Mexican fare. Single bathrooms aren't exactly conducive for great business either, and the bartenders yell at you for trying to split checks. Ehh, not so down. Super packed most nights, but people are mainly here for the margaritas, not the food or the ambiance. No good on either.
author: Danny C.

description:
Came here several weeks ago with a really pretty girl from school who I asked out to dinner.  She likes Mexican food and I do as well, and after one of my roommates recommended this restaurant and after reading mostly positive reviews, this restaurant was a perfect fit.

Some facts:

* At peak times in the evening, it is LOUD.
* It's especially crowded on Saturday nights, from what we observed.
* Finding parking isn't that easy.  Luckily, we managed to snatch a parking space directly across the street from the restaurant as someone was leaving.  Don't expect to be this lucky though.  I'm told, however, that apparently there's a free parking lot on 18th avenue that you can park in (not sure exactly where though).
* Portions are enormous and prices are reasonable for what you get.
* You will be brought chips and salsa (one mild and one spicy) before your main dish.

The only other negative I can think of aside from the loudness and the parking situation, is the fact that it took a while for the bill to arrive.  Overall, they get four stars from me.

4 stars
author: Michael F.

description:
OMG do NOT eat here, they are DIRTY.  The waiter with dark hair and face full of beard took a huge dump and did not wash his hands. 

That's DISGUSTING.
author: CherryIcee S.

description:
First I have to say...   The Bottle Brush Trees outside are absolutely amazing in their beauty!  Took our staff out for a festive dinner here and we had such a great time.  Jennifer took wonderful care of us from start to finish.   So did our excellent server, Antonio.    He never let our Top Shelf Double Margarita glasses go empty!   The quacamole and empanadas are outstanding.   Entrees were tasty and had a beautiful presentation.   The portion sizes are a lovely departure from the "we think you should eat like bird and pay a fortune" portion sizes that are all the rage at San Francisco's newer dining establishments.   There's something special about places that have been around 6 decades and we really felt the LOVE in everything they do.   

I agree it's all about the front room.   That's the place to be...   The back may work if you just want a quiet meal.   But they really should get a few bids on renovating that area.   Maybe they could rip out a wall and make the bar accessible from over there too.  

Anyway, huge thanks to everyone at Tia Margaritas!  You're awesome!
author: Michael W.

description: Great local neighborhood spot. Food is average, but the margaritas are made with fresh squeezed lime and are delicious.
author: Morgan F.

description: You better get there early, and not after 8:30 either, cause they will try to kick your a$$ outta there by 9pm. No joke. They'll start bussing your table and counting tips over you while you're in mid-meal.  As an ex-server at a busy family owned restaurant, I'm very conscious about not camping out at a table, but even being aware, they're sure let you know in real passive aggressive fashion, they're trying to go home by 9:05pm. Bums me out since this is/was a neighborhood go-to. Come Tias....  Customer service??  Or ain't nobody got time for that??
author: ang b.

description: Giving this place at least 1 star because we got seated right away, if it weren't for that I would definitely give no stars if that was an option.. Our waiter was a tall, average built man who looked Caucasian. He was exceptionally rude, we asked him if he can split the tab and he told us "I'll try, but my boss get anal about that" who says that?? How difficult is it to split 2 peoples tab? Obviously he has no manners. Not once did he come to refill our waters or ask if I wanted another beer, not very good at his job. Aside from that the food was garbage, the rice tastes like it was from a rice a roni box topped off with extra salt. The beans were mushy and everything overall tasted like it was from a box and just heated. Wouldn't recommend this place, you can get better food and service at Taco Bell!
author: Karen S.

description:
Just moved to the Inner Richmond and I'm so excited to have this place nearby!

The chips and salsa come out right away and definitely taste homemade. (Try not to eat too many...) I ordered the 2 chicken enchiladas plate, which came within 15 minutes. The enchiladas were huge, with large side portions too. 

The staff isn't overly friendly but they checked in on us to make sure all was well. I would recommend making a reservation in advance, just to get one of the nice window booths. If not, there's plenty of walk-in tables too.
author: Shelby R.

description:
I really like Tia's.  My criteria for a great Mexican meal is chips & salsa; top shelf margaritas;  order of guacamole. 
Tia's scores on all fronts. A couple of double top shelf margaritas will make you extremely happy. And Tia Special Enchiladas is just like the abuela.
Just stay out of the back room unless you enjoy not watching the game during dinner and lots of little kids.
author: J M.

description: Over priced. Margarita issue. We told them it was our first time and we ordered double margaritas. They tasted like koolaid. So maybe it doesn't matter what you order. Maybe they only pour singles and only charge doubles ?
author: Samantha S.

description: We've been wanting to try this place for a while, finally can on a day when it was open. When we entered the bar area was crowded, we were seated promptly. We tried to order a pitcher of margaritas and were told we could not only a single or double, The strawberry margaritas were very sweet. The chips were awful, maybe some of the worst I've ever had. The only thing that was good was the hotter salsa. I had to send back the chicken quesadilla, the chicken tasted very tough and old. The sever seemed upset and repeated its chicken, I told him it was not edible. Definitely we will not return.
author: Dee D.

description:
I recently went to Tia Margerita having heard great things about it. I ordered the sampler plate with one burrito, one taco and one quesadilla. the burrito was good but I was  sadly disappointed by the taco and quesadilla especially for this price. My friend had a carne asada taco for $13 and a carne asada burrito for $14. In my opinion definitely overpriced for the food that it was.
Even though I did not order it, I hear that the one thing to try from this place is the Chimichangas...
author: Romain D.

description: Good place for Mexican food. Casual and Not too fancy place for friends and family. Food quality good and helpful staff. Ordered Chicken Enchilada and chef's special combo plate. Good for 2 sharing.
author: Unyo N.

description: If I could rate this restaurant in three different categories I would give the food 4 stars, the atmosphere 3 stars and the wait staff 2 stars.  This restaurant is loud and difficult to carry on a conversation in. Our waiter was not friendly.
author: Thomas B.

description: This could be the worst Mexican restaurant in SF. I'm a native and this is the first time I've been here in my 31 yrs on Earth and I'm glad that my parents have steered me clear of this place my entire life. seriously- Uncle Bens rice???!!! And there margaritas are a total JOKE!!! And don't get me started on the Sangria or other not-so-fare to be had here. The service couldn't be more terrible than it is. This is as low as low gets folks. If this was the last place on Earth to eat, then I'd find a way to make dirt appealing rather than eat here. Now time to go home n barf what I already didn't finish n scrape my tongue.
author: Kristina M.

description:
Came here with a few friends about an hour before closing. Seated very quickly. We sat in the room with the bar and were able to watch the Giants game while we ate. 

I ordered a house margarita on the rocks and it was really good. The pictures on yelp of the margarita are accurate. 

I ordered the Combination Plate (Large). This plate came with a Chile Relleno that is possibly the best I have ever had, highly recommended. The plate also came with a carne Asada burrito, a chicken enchilada, and a tamale. All of the food was very tasty and very filling. So much so, had to take some of it home for breakfast in the morning. 

The service was good. We had a waiter that took out orders and was prompt with everything we needed and the hostess kinda backed him up and made sure when he was busy at other tables, we were taken cared of. 

If you like good quality food and great service I would recommend this place. I'm sure I'll be back again to visit soon.
author: Tony N.

description: I like Tia's. The margaritas are really good and STRONG. Great place to go with a group. Call ahead and it shouldn't be a problem getting a table. Food is good, not great. I'd recommend the carne asada plate (huge!). Fun neighborhood spot in the Richmond.
author: Ryan Y.

description: Simply amazing.  Another SF established restaurant that's been around for decades.  I'm only reviewing SF established restaurants...word to the wise...research a restaurant's longevity for the most accurate gauge of its quality....if it wasn't good, it wouldn't stick around.  The food is outstanding and I've been going for years pre and post renovations.
author: Freya M.

description: Absolutely atrocious customer service!! It was very disappointing how nasty the hostess as well as one of the manager/co-owners was. I will NEVER return there while they are under current management.
author: Marisol S.

description: Waiter was a jerk. Food was absolutely terrible. And price was outrageous. Ps. NOT Mexican rice. Rice pilaf, like the box you get at Safeway.
author: Jessie A.

description:
Whenever I come to San Francisco I stay with friends who are regulars and we usually eat and drink here at least once during my stay.  I love that this place has been around for 50 years and that it seems to be a hub for locals wanting a solid dining option. The staff always welcome my friends and I with smiles and great banter. 

Double margaritas are potent and cheap - though the balance of booze and lime isn't always consistent and I often ask for more lime juice as I like mine more on acidic side. Two of these on my first night and I have a great night's sleep.

The meals are gigantic - so either share or take leftovers home for breakfast the next day. The novelty of this is amusing for an Australian, as we don't really do the whole leftover thing. We also don't do endless supplies of free salsa and chips so I always eat far too many chips and get countless bowls of their salsa (the hot stuff is excellent!). Brilliant.
author: Tresna L.

description: When you're in the mood for authentic Mexican food this is a pretty good place to eat if you live in the neighborhood!I would probably go back again
author: Linda M.

description:
If I could give this place 0 stars I would.  I have never received such terrible service in my entire life.  The condescending hostess and rude waitress should have been a red flag to just turn around and walk out.

Let's set the scene.  I was excited for our fiesta date night so I was in a very good mood.  It was a Friday at 8pm and we walked up to the hostess table.  She was chatting with a customer so we waited politely for her to finish her conversation.  "2 people," we said.  She nodded and continued her conversation.  "Could we sit here?" we asked, pointing to an open table right next to us. "HAHAHAHA! No!" she exclaimed.  I asked the customer in front of me if I had said something funny because he had laughed too, and he replied, "Oh, because it's probably reserved."  I looked at the table, it wasn't.  

I decided to let it slide, it was Friday, I should chill.  The hostess led us to our table and the waitress handed us our menus.  "What would you like to drink?" she asked, as I sat down.  "Hm, water for now", I said, as I opened the menu.  "You don't want anything from the bar?!" she demanded.  My boyfriend had to reply 'No' for me because I was so shocked I couldn't respond.  My face looked like this : =O.  "I haven't opened the menu, so I don't know what I'd like to order from the bar", I replied back.  

We ordered our food shortly after and were promptly brought chips and two kinds of salsa.  After 20 minutes of waiting and eating chips, we waved down the waitress to ask for a drink menu.  She refused to give me a drink menu.  "What do you want?" she scoffed, "We're a bar, we have what's at a bar! Beer, margaritas!"  I just about had it.  I literally bit my tongue.  "Well", I explained, "he would like a beer, and he doesn't know what beer you have here."  She rattled off the different beers for him to select from and then recited what kind of margaritas were available.  We ordered.

With every tick of the clock, we were leaning more and more towards leaving and asking for our food to go.  After waiting for over an hour for our food, we decided that was enough, and we asked to have our food packed up.  The end.  The end of ever returning to Tia Margarita.
author: Kat N.

description: Pretty happy with this place and will be returning. Prices are decent, portions are enormous, but service could be better.
author: Samantga G.

description: No, it's not Gary Danko or French Laundry. They're not exploring new types of recipes, and they won't impress a foodie. Instead, iIt's a local institution, where you go for generous portions of Mexican-American comfort food with nice margaritas and a big screen for watching sports. Friendly staff, consistently good meals and good times: if that's what you're looking for,  the Tia delivers.
author: Al S.

description:
Wow, big portions!  I wanted the shrimp burrito, and the waiter asked if I wanted one or two.... I'm so glad I ordered one.  The shrimp was perfectly marinated, but didn't overwhelm the other flavors.  Yes, this burrito was more than the average burrito.

I'm allergic to tequila, so unfortunately I couldn't try the margaritas.  But I will come back again if I ever have a burrito craving.
author: Vira P.

description: Once again Francisco made the best Margaritas!  The green cheese enchiladas were excellent. The atmosphere is light and the conversation at the bar is always enjoyable.
author: Me M.

description:
Dont fill up on the tortilla chips as the portions here will blow your mind. My wife and I decided to give it a try. Actually it was MY idea. I pat myself on the back.  When we entered, we had no idea where to go or wait to be seated, as it wasnt clear which way to walk. After being a little confused about where to go once inside, we got a nice table away from the bar. Yes its a bar and grill kind of a place, it was very lively and had a party like atmosphere. It was pretty noisy, but it was fun. Well it is a bar after all, not a public library. The food to me was excellent, possibly the best Mexican food Ive ever eaten. I had the Chimichonga which was just out of this world delicious, fresh, hot food, with rice and beans on a huge plate. Certainly NOT greasy. My wife had the combo of a taco and enchilada and was also excellent. The service was great, one guy was really friendly, he looked like John Travolta as he looked in the movies Swordfish and Pulp Fiction. He even shook my hand before we left. Great guy ! 
Just dont fill up on the chips - as you near the end of one bowl of chips another will wind up on your table. You can easily fill up on the chips so be careful, or like us, you will be bloated and simply float home. A little green tea will help the digestion !
Great food
Great service
Great atmosphere
We will return !! Although I will probably not eat anything on the day we go..
author: David S.

description: The food is very average which sucks because at first it looks very authentic. They lack variety in their menu. I had the green enchiladas and they are decent with good amount of chicken. The thing I didn't like was the lettuce side with salsa on top as if it was the dressing. That is not Mexican. The margaritas on the other side are very good. I had the Top Shelf frozen one and it's delish! Would totally recommend them. The atmosphere is good, I sat in the dining area behind the bar but the horseshoe bar area had a lively and fun vibe. I'd say that's the spot to be in.
author: Luis O.

description: We took a Lyft from the wharf to here; little out of the way but the food was very good!  Beware of the margaritas as they are VERY dangerous....(in a good way of course).  After a delicious plate of food and two of them I was ready for a siesta!
author: Ashley R.

description: Terrible service. Bartender was extremely rude and seemed drunk at the time. Would not recommend at all.
author: Aida G.

description: Mexican Mamas should descend from heaven to spank the people responsible for serving this food.. The refried beans had a crust on top often seen from over microwaving, the rice tasted like Rice A Roni, we found a hair in the rice... What else.. The main bartender was super rude and kept mean mugging my man.. I WILL NEVER GO BACK. After telling them of the hair and my lack of appetite after, they comped one of our entrees. Not enough to save us as customers however...
author: Kristine P.

description:
I have to say that this place was a bit surprising! They must be a popular joint because the restaurant got pretty crowded very quickly. At first when you walk in all you see is the bar, it literally takes up most of the room and there are a few booths that surround the line the rest of the place. Also has a weird musty smell to it when you walk in. ( they need to air this place more often) now the servers and everyone are friendly and quite attentive. The decor is pretty old and I noticed duct tape to patch up certain parts of the furniture. 
     Now for the food! They start you off with the chips and two kinds of salsa. One was spicy and one mild and I have to say the mild seemed like ketchup with bits of tomato and onion to make it seem like salsa. However the spicy salsa was on point! Next the food, HUGE portions. Def worth the price of what you are getting. Main was GREAT ( burrito, enchilada, flautas)  but the sides were meh...black beans weren't cooked thoroughly, their salad is just shredded lettuce with the mild salsa and the rice is buttered. Wasn't a huge fun. Overall experience was great and I would def go back to try some more items. Oh also the alcohol is strong. Yum. Try the margaritas and they have a good selection of beer!! Haha!!
author: Mandi K.

description:
I finally made it to Tia Margarita. I'd been hearing about their very strong margaritas and laid back atmosphere for quite a while and was excited to finally try it.
I loved the overflowing bowl of chips with the two types of salsas and the guacamole was pure avocados.
I ordered the beef chimichanga, an enormous dish served with rice, beans, and shredded iceberg lettuce, and found it to be a bit lacking in flavor, but kind of what you expect with most shredded beef.
As promised, the margaritas were super strong, but I actually would have appreciated a bit more margarita mix, lime juice, or cointreau to cut the tequila.
author: Teryll H.

description:
We went to Tia Margarita for dinner tonight.  We have been eating at this restaurant for over 40 years, and this is the worst I have ever had there.

Something has changed there, the service is horrible, and the food has really gone downhill.   The Waiter was rude and inattentive and our simple dishes took over 1 hour to appear and when they finally did the food was nasty.   

Don't eat there! NASTY NASTY NASTY!
author: Osos I.

description:
My friend and I went to Tia tonight.
We left the restaurant, 5-10 minutes later I realized I left my iPhone at the table.
We called it and it went straight to VM.  I never turn my phone off.
I drove back talk to the staff and no one would own up to who cleaned our table.
The cleaning table crew stole my iPhone and I hold this restaurant responsible.
My iPhone was wiped at 10:55, because the thief turned it back on after they left Tia Margarita.
I don't eat at restaurants that higher thieves.
author: Angela K.

description:
In the spirit of Cinco de Drinko, we decided to meet some friends for food and margaritas at Tia Margarita's. This was my first time dining here and I was excited to try a new Mexican place. 

However, my excitement turned into disappointment when we learned that we couldn't join our friends since there was an 2 hour time limit per table for Cinco de Mayo (they had already been there awhile).
