The wait for a table was running an hour and a half, so the boyfriend and I decided to hunt for a spot at the bar. Luckily, about 15 minutes later we found seats at the bar.

The bartenders were extremely fast and efficient with drinks and were very nice. They could definitely keep up with the crowds, so you didn't have to wait long for drinks - always a plus! They also gave us free chips and salsa for starters, which we loved.

We were starving so we decided to both order the Enchiladas Racheras - two enchiladas covered in cheese and salsa, a side of beans (refried or black), rice, and salad. The enchiladas were very good and actually pretty tasty - I loved the bell peppers and onions. The rice was a little bland and needed some spice and the beans were pretty standard. Overall, I enjoyed my meal but felt it was missing 'something'.

While the service was great and the food satisfying, I don't know if I'd make the trek out here for some Mexican food when there are cheaper and closer options for me in the Mission. However, I wouldn't count Tia Margarita's out when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Stephanie C.

description: This place has awesome and affordable old school Mexican food.  I grew up in SoCal and this place reminds me so much of restaurants I went to as a kid--the family atmosphere, the big, huge warm plates full of rice and beans, the endless baskets of chips.  Get the cheese dip.  It is EPIC.
author: D D.

description:
When I looked around for a nice place to grab some margaritas on Cinco De Mayo I thought a place with the name "Margarita" in it would be perfect . I was wrong. When my friend and I walked into the restaurant we were stared at for 20 seconds by the bartender and the waitress. After about 30 seconds of awkwardness in a non crowded room, "Are you here for dinner?" we were finally asked by the waitress. We decided to sit outside, which was nice on a warm day. 

I asked right off about the margaritas and was told, "We have strawberry and regular margaritas. We have well and top shelf on our menu and just so you know we will be serving them in plastic cups because you guys are sitting outside."

No problem I thought. Well margaritas can't be more than 4-5 dollars each. I was wrong about that also. 

First of all no one lets you know that the portions are HUGE. They can easily feed two hungry people and I'm really glad we shared a plate considering it was $15 and there were no options of anything cheaper. We were given two dirty plates of our own which we sent back after having to yell "EXCUSE ME" since we were barely checked on by a waitress who didn't even know what types of enchiladas were available. We were given one clean plate and another dirty plate. Come on....

The food was so-so. I wouldn't consider it authentic Mexican. The rice had cold spots and the sauces weren't even flavorful at all.

When we got the bill we see that the margaritas are 9$ each. "Oh they are double shot margaritas for Cinco De Mayo..." says the waitress after not letting us know when we originally asked. If you have a special that day you need to let the customers know when they sit down! 

I told her I wasn't paying for it and she made the drinks 6 dollars each which was nice but I was still frustrated. I came to find out the woman who seated us was the OWNER!? Wow. Not even the owner could inform us of the specials for Cinco De Mayo in an unpacked restaurant. 

I have no idea if this place is usually good on a non-holiday but I was extremely disappointed. I would have rather grabbed some grub at the taqueria around the corner on Geary and made my own margaritas at home.
author: Ashley M.

description: If you like Margaritas and eating basic, good Mexican food you'll like Tia Margarita. I liked the chips and salsa which is a good indication of a Mexican place. it's a nice neighborhood restaurant. I look forward to going back again to check out the consistency of the food and drinks.
author: Gwen M.

description:
If you like STRONG margs (like almost clear), then this is the place for you. The bartenders here are no joke and will serve you up a great marg. They are also hilarious, which is a plus as well. 

The food is OK -- I come here for the atmosphere mainly as it has a huge bar and I prefer to eat at a bar. 

Long story, short - If you are looking to drink, come here. If you are looking for great mexican food, head to Tommy's down the street.
author: Chelsea A.

description: Ex-pat Texans listen up.  You know that run of the mill tex-mex place that was in the small town you grew up in?  The one with the vinyl booths, cheesy mexican music, unlimited chips and salsa, and not-great-but-good-enough-tex-mex?  Well Tia Margarita is pretty much that place, but in San Francisco.  Yes, they don't have queso, and yes the food here won't hold a candle to good tex-mex from Texas, but everything here is good enough and close enough to what you're homesick for to scratch that tex-mex itch.  The margaritas are pretty damned good (and strong), the spicy salsa is actually spicy, and the menu features things like fajitas, chimichangas, and ranchero sauce enchiladas.  Service was great, and the portions were huge.  I'll happily return any time I have a hankering for tex-mex but don't feel like hopping on a plane to Austin or Dallas.
author: Joshua W.

description: Tia Margarita, your service tonight, with the exception of your gracious hostess, was so atrocious that for the first time ever in my life, I didn't tip my server.
author: LeAndra M.

description:
Definitely not authentic Mexican food by any means. I didn't expect much stopping in here during a bike ride considering it was in the Richmond, but we figured we would try it. The margaritas are strong, but not good. I got a chile relleno/taco combo. The relleno was not bad, it seemed fresh which is hard to come by since usually when I order one somewhere it's obviously been prepared ahead of time and microwaved. I would have liked it a lot more if it had Mexican cheese in it instead of jack. Chicken taco was fine. The rice is pretty terrible. It tastes like rice-a-roni or some other premade rice brand. My boyfriend liked his beef flauta.
The server, although nice, didn't come check on us at all and it was right before the dinner rush so it wasn't that busy yet. 
The food was acceptable and filled us up, but we probably won't be going back.
author: Karissa Q.

description: First time here. Great first impression. Our friend had been raving about the 'horseshoe bar' and the lovely atmosphere. It did not disappoint. The bartenders were just as part of the scene as the strong margaritas they were serving up. The food was just okay, but complemented along with all the other parts of the restaurant, I gave it all a 5-star. Pedro and Francisco really care about service and making sure their customers are pleased. We will be returning.
author: Lilian P.

description:
2 stars for the service and mediocre margaritas. 

We came here for happy hour after a volunteering event for work. There was a group of 10-11 of us, and the hostess and bartender immediately frowned upon our arrival. Although they accommodated our large group, they were very rude and pushy about where we were going to sit and how we were going to pay. They did not seem happy at all to serve us.

The restaurant was also in Outer Richmond and the average age of the bar before our group entered was around 50. 

Although the chips/salsa and margaritas weren't bad...I probably wouldn't come here on my own again because of the rude bartenders. The only good thing about the place was that it wasn't crowded and they were able to seat us right away (despite being grumpy about it).
author: Lillian C.

description: I came here a few nights ago for a get together with some old friends I have not seen in awhile. This was my first time at Tia Margaritas. So I decided to read some Yelp reviews and check out some photos. A lot of people complained about how they got charged for a double margarita, when they in fact ordered a single. Well, well! It happened to me too as well. My partner and I both ordered single margaritas and the server repeated our order. But when we get the check, we got charged for doubles! And we complain but get scolded that we were wrong?! Wow really?!  And they did not edit the check whatsoever. Anyways, just had to share. The food is fine, you can definitely share a plate with another person. I'm not sure if I will be back and I am a local from the neighborhood who loves to support local businesses. Thanks for the shade Tia margaritas, not cool at all. You don't scold customers like that. NO BUENO!
author: Nana P.

description: I really really had some high expectations from this place. My brother lives about 100 footsteps away from here and while visiting him, I thought I'd make a stop because of all the amazing things I've heard and how amazing their food looks in pictures. My mom and I walked in as soon as they opened on a Thursday afternoon at 4pm. Which by the way their hours are kind of odd and I have no idea why it's set up that way but it has always been very inconvenient. Nonetheless, we were seated right away, our server came to us with our menus, we ordered our beverages, and we didn't want to grub to the max so we wanted to share a plate. We told the server we wanted to share the large combo plate which gave you three items. He immediately stopped me and said there is a $6 charge for splitting a plate which really shocked me. I have NEVER EVER in my entire dining history even at some of the most top notch places in Los Angeles, heard that there is any charge for wanting to share a meal. I told him that was probably the most ridiculous thing I've heard and he was understanding and said that he wanted to let us know before we ordered that way just so we are aware which I'm glad he did. Especially after seeing so many reviews about how they add extra charges on to people's bills. Anyways, we asked him what if we wanted to split an appetizer? He said that's fine, there is no extra charge for that. I just felt like, they shouldn't be the ones deciding how much money we should spend or how much food we should be eating. We just ordered the quesadillas, which were really yummy and their salsas are really delicious as well. I just don't know that I would care to come back, or at least not when they JUST open because it's pretty clear by the attitude and vibe of the whole place that they hate being there, maybe until it gets busy but, I'm a fan of Mexican food so I'm pretty sure I can find another place anywhere else that won't decide how to eat my meal or spend my money.
author: Sapna G.

description: We had to wait  45 min.  for  dinner kids were starving .   Our server Rico was apologetic and awesome!! .  We were told  that management was notified about our wait.. Wished management apologized but  didn't... But as always the food was great!! Thus 4 stars - 1 for the long wait.. They weren't even busy....
author: Johnny C.

description: It had been a while (10+ years) since I was last there until last month. Still good food for a decent price! The margaritas were pretty strong and the food was pretty delicious and plentiful. It's a great place to have dinner with a group of friends. I'll be sure to be back a lot sooner!
author: Alex Y.

description:
I was craving a chili relleno, and wanted to try some place new. So I plugged in the keyword Chili Relleno," and the location parameters of Inner/Outer Sunset/Richmond. This place came up with 4.5 stars.  After reading what other yelpers had to say, I decided to give this place a try.   One of the reviewer's makes indicates lack of attention to incoming patrons.  There was no host/hostess podium at the entrance.  I waited for a couple of minutes before communicating to the bartender that I'd like of be seated for dinner.  He pointed to a podium situated at the other end of the room.  There was no on standing there.  I made my way there, and was eventually seated by the hostess.

The ambiance is very dark, and did nothing for me.  I ordered the combination plate with a chicken enchilada, chili relleno, and a beef taco.  The food was served hot, however for me there could have been more chicken in the enchilada, more beef in the taco, and more cheese in the chili relleno.  Furthermore, the relleno was mostly batter.  The sauce on the enchilada did not have much flavor.  Have had much better in the Mission, and elsewhere.
author: Robin A.

description:
Finally paid a visit to Tia Margarita. It's actually a good restaurant. But, you should know, the portions are HUGE. They have very little salad or veggies, mostly Mexican comfort food. So prepare yourself for a huge plate. I saw someone with not one, but two burritos on their plate!

The food is really good, and the margaritas are strong. The service was exceptional. I'd go back, but probably just for happy hour.
author: Michelle W.

description:
My partner and I have been fans of Tia's for 2+ years. 

2 doubles on the rocks with salt. Split a Chimichanga plate with shredded beef, refried beans, and jalapeños on side. Sit at the bar.  Totally worth the drive from Berkeley!  Parking can be difficult on weekend nights but usually we find something along Geary. Arriving shortly before 6pm and paying a bit on the metered parking spots is a good way to do it. 

Their margaritas are the best I've had, nice and strong with freshly squeezed lime. No bogus drink mixes. And who can say no to a deep fried burrito? Drool!
author: Sarah B.

description: I really like this place because it's better than Chevy's that is still downtown. Tia margarita's reminds me of the la Barca room, that was in the marina up until 2011. The food was really good there and same quality as Tia Margarita! I miss the la Barca room because the place was bigger than Tia margarita. The one thing I don't like is the wait, we came 3 people and the wait was an hour at 8pm I think is ridiculous!
author: Alix J.

description:
Well, I can't say I'm not super disappointed. We walked by this place months ago and peeked our head in to see what it was like. It looked like a solid, bustling neighborhood spot that we were excited to try at some point. Since we moved to the neighborhood recently, we were excited at having the prospect of a cute mexican place, cause there's certainly enough Sushi and Thai food to choose from.

We wanted to sit at the bar. It was full, so we were planing to sit at a table. I've worked in this industry for 10 years in high end restaurants in this city so I know what awful service looks like. This is absolutely what we got, and it only unravelled from when we walked in the door.

NO ONE acknowledged we were there. Since there wasn't a sign that said "Seat Yourself" we weren't about to. I fucking hate it when people do. We stood at the front door for at least a few minutes, but long enough to wonder if there was a separate entrance and we came in the wrong way. Tired of waiting for a host that obviously wasn't coming or not working I started to get a waitpersons attention.

When I asked him if there was a host, he pointed to a young lady chatting up one of the tables, who then looked over at us and then continued talking to the table. Whatever. Not a big deal. Take care of your guests, I get it. The waiter was extremely polite and sat us immediately at a table and promptly took drink orders. Ok. Cool. I don't like walking into a restaurant and figuring out for myself how to get seated for five minutes, but things are looking up.

Drinks come, he's in the middle of taking our order when another table is leaving and they engage in conversation, while we're sitting there in the middle of ordering. I'll also mention that the host hasn't left that table she was at upon our arrival and it's now been easily 15 minutes. Waiter is finally available to finish taking our order. He's a nice guy, but I'm already realizing people aren't coming for the service, so it must be the food and the super strong margaritas,.

At the average price of $18 a plate I was skeptical. When the food arrived the portions were HUGE, but it doesn't matter how large portion sizes are when the food tastes nowhere close to authentic. Colibri and or Tres Agaves can get away with charging these prices, but definitely not this place. Did I mention that the host is now sitting at the table she was chatting up, because standing was getting too tiresome at that point for her?

As we sat there, we were both bummed. Bad food, bad service, waiter was nice, but I mean the host? Give me a fucking break. Your job is to greet people upon arrival. Not pay extra attention to people you obviously know. THE BEST PART: THE TABLE NEXT TO US GETTING ALL THE SPECIAL ATTENTION WERE THE OWNERS!!! So while everything else is going to shit in terms of guest experience, at least the owners need for nothing.

We were there an hour and a half too long. Finally the host got up and did her job, and the owner went to the credit card machine to help, I guess. The owner dropped our check off after receiving payment and didn't look us in the eye to thank us or thank me by my last name (not a big deal, but at least make eye contact when you thank someone). I realized she didn't have time to do either of those things cause she was too worried about saying goodbye to some drunk regulars.

Must be nice to feel special in the biggest shithole in the Richmond.
author: Alexis K.

description:
We've been to Tia Margarita several times and were never disappointed, but last night was our last night at Tia Margarita's. Is good service and a good margarita too much to ask for?

Our server was beyond awful, our basic blended margaritas tasted like dirty bathwater, and I can get better food at my local taqueria.

There are far too may Mexican restaurants with great food and margaritas in San Francisco to waste your time on this place. I'm all for neighborhood "gems", but this gem needs some polishing, starting with its wait staff and bartenders.
author: Irene G.

description: Stopped in the place for a quick bite... Bs'd w/some regulars that were friendly & full of stories! Bartender was energetic & out going & has been there 20 years! Margarita was tasty & the Sampler was AWESOMELY HUGE.  House made empanadas, wings, quesadilla, & 4 good size mini burritos (2) Chicken | (2) Beef... Yum!
author: Sleven M.

description: This place is a ok. I would have not chosen this place. The food here is ok. I am not really in Mexican food. I only came here because I was with a group. This place is also too small for me. I like restaurants with more room inside. I won't be coming back here anytime soon. This place is also too expensive for such a small restaurant.
author: Isaac H.

description:
Went last night. 
Place is not really high on my scale
Margarita not bad have had far better.
We split an enchilada verde bit dull
Way to much sour creme to me

Next time in the area it's Tommy's again.
author: Michael F.

description: Just your standard taco house. All the usual suspects, at decent prices for SF. Margaritas are average. Just an average ol' place. Good for kids.
author: Alex L.

description: If you can sit at the bar do so at all costs to avoid the hostesses. The owner lady is always nice and polite but the other ones can be so rude. They are so tactless and disrespectful to customers who just want a place to sit down and eat. I mean, who gets in a customers face and tells them to move to a different seat so a regular can have their spot? Then the same girl basically verbally assaults the bartender in front of everyone. I love Tias, but only if I sit at the bar now. I've given up on the idea of bringing friends here because I would have to deal with the hostesses to get a table... So sad.
author: Kayli B.

description: Went there with my two children 9 and 11. Ordered a carne asada plate, which was $20 bucks for my children to share! A enchilada plate for me, drinks, guacamole and chips. Because my kids split the carne asada they charged me extra! What! Rude and slow service. Never going back.
author: Michelle Z.

description: I have been here twice & The food was decent, and the service was just terriable!!! They're just so rude!
author: Elisa C.

description:
I'm always looking to try new and exciting off the beaten path. I had purchased some half off dinner vouchers for Tia Margarita online months ago and completely forgot about them.  Since the vouchers expired yesterday, I went with a friend to try the place out. Each voucher was good for 2 small (not small by any means) combo dishes and 2 margaritas.  We could only use one of the vouchers last night.  The Manager, Jennifer, kindly extended the second voucher it so that I could either come back or give it to someone else to enjoy.  

This place was great!  A pleasant find; I will recommend and return to with family and friends. We were greeted right away and provided a table.  Chips and 2 types of salsa were brought to our table. Showed our friendly server our vouchers and he told us what was included.  Made us feel very welcomed.  Portion sizes are very generous...plenty for lunch left over's.  The small combo dish came with two main dish choices, black beans, rice and green salad.  The rice and beans were full of flavor as was the entire dish (Shredded Beef Burrito and a Chile Relleno).  The Margaritas are as original as you can get.  Our meals came with a Double Top Shelf Margaritas; a few sips of that and you are on cloud 9!  :)  A little too strong at first but as the ice melted, it was fine and fully enjoyed!  

The horseshoe shaped bar is very inviting.  By the time we were half way through our meal, the place was busy inside for a Wed. night.  People picking up orders to go, dining in or just grabbing a drink and chat at the bar.  We never felt rushed to leave yet not forgotten either.  

A fantastic first experience to a well hidden gem off the beaten path!  Looking forward to my return!  :)
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Parking is bad.  As for the food... nice (not great) staple and priced well.  I've been here for more than 10 times and it's satisfying cause it's a sit down place that is decent and dark.  Old school tables and chairs and decor.  Unlimited flour tortillas and butter. The best thing I've found, is to order the 3 item and include a beef burrito - and take home the burrito for another day.  It is definitely worth more than just an item on the plate. If you break the cost down, it is a $7 "Gordo's" burrito for around $5 ... yeah, I sounded cheap just then but $2 is a bus ride.  But that's my take on Tia Margarita.

The barflies seems like a lot of locals and they seem happy.
author: Andrea K.

description:
When I walked into this place, I knew right away that I wouldn't like it. Having the bar at the front was a bit confusing, not to mention it reminded me of the Marina (ew, I feel dirty all of a sudden...). The hostess was nice, but she blended right in with the crowd at the bar! We were seated in the back in a very dimly lit room. I have terrific vision according to my eye check up, but I had a difficult time reading the menu. Finally, about half an hour later, the hostess turned the lights on to a brighter setting.

Oh yeah, half an hour after I sat down, I still had my menu. Well, at least I could read it now. Our waitress was an old lady who was moving very slowly. I commend her for still working at her age, but man... sometimes you just gotta know when to hang it up. At a busy, fast-paced restaurant, you need to be quick, not hard of hearing, and not forgetful. Let's face it... you have to be young. I'm not trying to sound harsh, but it's the truth. I know, she probably needs to work, etc. etc. etc. Fine. I'm not against old people working... just find another job, not waitressing at a busy restaurant.

Anyway, needless to say, she was really slow, we had to repeat our orders at least five times, and she continuously forgot to get us drinks. We got our chips right away from the bus boy, but never received any water. The bus boy was friendly and fast. We ended up just asking him for a lot of things. Perhaps the waitress thought it was beneath her to bring us water. It is, after all, a bus boy's job.

Onto the food... it was average. This is as whitewashed of a Mexican restaurant as it gets. The only thing I remember was my flauta, which was very crispy, the way they should be. The salsa was good, and the chips seemed fresh.

I guess if you like the Americanized sour cream drenched, cheese covered enchilada two/three item combos, then this is the place to go. I would think twice before going back.
author: Sara K.

description: Our taxi driver recommended this place while dropping us off at our AirBNB. The server brought over some chips and two types of salsa, but didn't tell us that one of them was HOT as hell. Ordered the Chili con queso, fajitas, and enchiladas. Food was terrific, the chili con queso was SUPER stringy. All the food was good and left full and happy with a doggy bag.
author: AJ L.

description:
We LOVE Tia's.  Chips & salsa + double margaritas + chicken burritos = happy us.  All the employees are very friendly (Tony is awesome) and always try to find us a spot in the bar area.  Hopefully in 20 years when we pass the 1000 burrito mark, we'll have a permanent booth reserved for us with our names engraved on a commemorative plate-shaped plaque.

P.S. I don't understand why people even compare Tia's and Tommy's.  The food and service are much better at Tia's, and yes Tommy's has tequila but I believe the Tia's margaritas contain that as well.
author: Laura And Adam F.

description:
Tia Margarita is by far one of the best consistent Mexican restaurants in San Francisco. I frequent this restaurant often knowing that everything I never leave disappointed or hungry.

The portions are large, like any traditional Mexican restaurant, but what really sets this apart from the standard ole Mexican cuisine, us Californians have come to love is the spices and flavor. 

I always go with my go to dish here, the Pollo Asada plate which had three large chicken breast seasoned just perfect and grilled, with rice and beans. It's absolutely amazing. Simply one of the best, most easy dishes but yet Tiá Margarita finds a way to make it that much better. I have never once left this restaurant hungry for more food. Matter of a fact I always leave with leftovers which is just as good the next day as it was the night before.

If you happen to be In the area don't miss the opportunity to enjoy the tasty, delicious and hearty entrees coming out of the kitchen of Tia Margarita!
author: Jason F.

description: My favorite Mexican Restaurant in SF.  Amazing atmosphere, killer margaritas (no sour mix in the building) and huge portions of great food.  The habanero salsa is amazing too.
author: Dan L.

description: From walking in on people (owners?) yelling at one another in the doorway to having the waitress awkwardly stare us down our dining experience was not off to a good start. We were seated in the bar area and waited quite awhile before a friendly waiter came and took our order. He was prompt in getting our drink order but, kind of forgot about us when it came to our food and chips and salsa. It was pretty noisy and it was obvious that this is a locals spot and wish the staff was more friendly. Our food arrived hot and smelled amazing! I ordered the enchilada and it was very good. My boyfriend ordered the fajitas and had to ask for tortillas even though they came with the meal. All in all the food was very good, but the ambience was very uninviting, probably will not return.
author: K T.

description: Favorite Mexican restaurant in the Bay Area. The best carne asada, margaritas, chili relleno, shrimp gaunbas. Excellent portions, highly recommend!!
author: Joe M.

description:
The two reviews from 5/5 and 5/6 just cracked me up.  Its like they went to some "bizaro" parallel universe rather than the place I know.  

Every time I walk into this place it has the same familiar customers; consistent and tasty margaritas; and decent food dishes.  And I sit at the bar when I come, which is not often, but when I'm there everything is consistently good.  Each margarita is prepared with tequila, triple sec, and at least two whole limes - because I watch them make these drinks.

The salsa of late comes in a spicy red, or a red with a bit of garlic.  They appear fresh and I am a lover of good salsas, and they definitely are consistent there as well.  The rice - now I imagine they are either cooked with one of two spices to add the coloring and flavor - turmeric or saffron.  

One of the things that cracks me up the most with reviews is how people take on a restaurant review on one of the busiest days and expect that to be typical.  The hyperbole in these two reviews had me laughing.

The drinks are good and strong - what's not to like.  If its TOO STRONG, then only drink one and let the ice melt.  No one likes overly salty food or the wrong dishes to be sure although  I've never had the wrong food served to me here.  But again, if you pick the busiest day in a restaurant's year, please be smart and cut the restaurant some slack.  Go back and try it on a day when the staff isn't slammed.  Its only fair.

And on a note about their margaritas - on the rocks - and much better than Tommy's IMHO.  I don't know what tequila they use, but the end product is way better than most restaurants.  I find Tommy's way too tart.  A good margarita in my book needs just that hint of sweet that you get from a triple sec or contreau.
author: Philip M.

description: I wanted to love this place but sadly it was terrible. The lady who runs the place is super rude and had no manners. What kind of person doesn't greet you when you walk in! On to the food, the salsa was sooo salty and tasted like it came from a picante sauce bottle. The waiter came up to me and said I don't know what to give you, In my head I was like make new salsa! The only good thing about this place was the bar.
author: Christian A.

description:
Love this place.  True neighborhood family style Mexican restaurant.  This is the outer Richmond - - - do not expect anything fancy!

Good margaritas - check
plentiful chips & salsa (mild and hot) - - check
Varied menu - - check

I love that this place doesn't try and be anything that it's not.  No pretense and hasn't seen a remodel in quite some time.  But, that's part of the charm.
author: Tobin S.

description:
WHOA on the harsh reviews!  Complaining that a drink is *too* strong? Get the heck outta here!  And making fun of the sweet elderly waitress with the hearing aid, would you be happier if she were working in the back stuffing empanadas or something? I mean jeez have a little bit of patience and compassion.   

I feel like this is kinda like saying "they had great water!" but their quesadillas are off the hook!!!  I usually scoff at corn tortillas, but they are what MAKE the quesadillas here.  I have never ordered the one with meat, because the cheesy oozy buttery one gives me lady wood every time.  The thing is though, you gotta eat it FAST because it's only "last meal" worthy if you eat it right when they place it on the table...honestly if you could snatch a piece while the waitress/er is placing it on your table that's the sweet spot.  

Per some Yelp recommendations I got the Sampler this time - THANKS GUYS, it was the best idea ever.  Everything on it was deep-fried except for maybe the quesadilla and the burritos, and I didn't even have to choose between chicken or beef because I was brought 2 of each in the form of spinach and tomato tortillas, and when I dropped my taquito in my margarita on accident, I was brought 2 new taquitos (cause 1 on a plate would be lonely) AND a new margarita!
author: Megan A.

description:
I will absolutely go back. 

Pro's:
-The service was quick.
-Everyone working there is so nice!
-The margaritas were on point.
-The food was delicious and never seemed to end!
-The menu doesn't overwhelm you when looking at it but it does make you want to order one of everything!
-The bartender!!! He is so nice & very welcoming!!!

Con's:
-One of the salsa dishes was just to spicy to enjoy. The burning sensation took away from the actual taste which sucked because I like spicy.
-The reception area was well into the bar. Not horrible but a bit confusing.

Looking forward to trying more off the menu!
author: Tam T.

description:
Good food, large portions.  Margaritas were strong, but pretty expensive considering the majority of the drink was ice (2 sips of my double margarita and it was gone).  

Chips were good, salsa was amazing.  The hot salsa was a real tongue burner, use caution.  Side note from a tourist - the burritos weren't smothered, which is pretty standard where we are from in Colorado.
author: Mary M.

description: I love this place! The best double margaritas in town and you don't need more! Yummy food and family friendly atmosphere. Best in the 'hood! Very accommodating chef & waiters! Yummy! Will be Back!
author: Mary P.

description:
The food is good, pretty standard Mexican fare. A bit bland for my taste, nothing exciting, but huge portions, a good place to come hungry, food arrives quickly.

Come here for the friendly service and the tasty margaritas! It's a great place to watch a game and hang out.
author: Kelly T.

description:
We had really nice dinner tonight at Tia Margarita. Food was really yummy as usual with generous portions.  My favorite is the mild salsa that is almost sweet. 

The best part of dinner was the exceptional service we received from Duncan. They are lucky to have him, as he's super friendly and efficient.  I was dining with a 3 year old and he made us feel very welcome.   Fast service, accommodating, on top of drink refills and very personable.  We'll be back and hope to have him serve us again.
author: Cynthia R.

description:
I love this place!  We have been going there for years, it's a neighborhood gem.  If you read the negative reviews, you usually see something like "we showed up with a large group" or "we showed up on a crowded Friday night with several children."  Duh.

This is exactly what a neighborhood restaurant should be.  Old-style family mexican, emphasis on combination platters and lovely margs.  If you don't dig it, feel free to shove off for the high-priced nouveau small-portion joints downtown.
author: Chris S.

description:
Francisco is the greatest person!! So friendly and amazing. Also margaritas are strong.. Very good 
Great atmosphere
Complimentary chips & salsa were so nice to get. The hot salsa was so hot I was tearing up.. Pretty intense considering I love spicy stuff
Can't rate on the food because we didn't get any but we will be back to try
author: Taylor D.

description: I normally would not come to a place like this but because of parking and driving by it 4x I decided to finally come in once I found a spot close by and came in. After eating a wonderful meal very fast service while it was very busy on a Saturday night and the great margaritas that were strong! I am so glad I couldn't find parking so I was able to find this gem! Will definitely be coming back since I am new to the neighborhood!
author: Karli S.

description: I know many people like the drinks and the atmosphere and the tradition.  I have no dispute with that. But the food is just nasty.  If it weren't for the off-tastes it would have no flavor at all.  If your friends insist on eating here, have a margarita and chips and then head to any - I mean ANY - taqueria in the city and the food will be better.
author: gar l.

description: Great value, really good margaritas!  I don't know why this place doesn't have five stars.
author: Rod H.

description: Rough around the edges is the best way to describe this restaurant, the employees and the clientele. The staff sort of acts like they don't really care. The guy who brought me my plate neglected to tell me the plate would be scalding hot. The food takes a long time and is pretty mediocre. This place will not survive the next wave of gentrification.
author: William B.

description:
No, no, no, no, no. This isn't it. This Americanized, sour-creamenized, over-sized, syruppy margharitas-enized, no, no, no. This isn't it.
Please SF, give me some Mexican food the way a grandma makes it: with love!
author: Brian J.

description:
We loved this place when stopping in the day before my birthday. The mission was nachos and nachos we got! The food is pretty good. The meats satisfied, and the chile rellenos and enchiladas were good enough! 

But seriously, once we got a margarita from an AWESOME bartender, who more than happily tweaked ours because they were a little two sweet to start with, we swore that we'd LOVE the place as long as the food was even remotely good. 

They make a lot of margaritas here, and they seem to really love doing it!
author: Luke M.

description:
'Well we didn't get sick from it.'

This is what my husband said in response to my 'what did you think of Tia's.' I thought I should throw my 5 cents into the pot of mixed reviews of this place. We went because we were meeting a group and probably wouldn't have eaten there otherwise... I'd never heard of it and hoped that maybe it was a hidden gem. 

Well there's nothing bejeweled about TIa's. If you like rice of the Uncle Ben's microwave variety, beans from a can,  quesadillas oil coated, ketchup-y salsa...then please do come here, you will love it. Sigh. The salad was more an afterthought, limp shredded iceberg struggling to breathe under another layer of salsa. Because the 2 cups of ketch-salsa you gave me with my chips wasn't enough. There was guacamole, it was powdery. WTF how can guac be powdery?! I don't know guys, but it was. At least there wasn't a lot of it. 

The staff were rude. Our server repeatedly told us to move our stuff out the way even though there was plenty of room for her to get past. If I could cram a stroller under a table I would, jeez. 

Here's the deal. If you are local, you might like this place for margs. If you are a bit of a loner, you might like to hang out with the other loners at the bar. If you are anyone else, do. not. go. here. ever. SF has so much more to offer!  

Oh fffff I forgot to mention - it is SO EXPENSIVE. Who on earth charges $10 for a quesadilla? WHO?! It's a plate with beans and rice and salad, but as mentioned before, the sides are all severely sub par canned/bagged crap that don't taste like anything. 

:-(
author: Rachel G.

description:
Two girlfriends and I went here last night after discovering Tommy's is currently closed. (I guess we all deserve a vacation from time to time.) We really wanted margaritas, and those are difficult to come by in the Richmond. 

We waited about 20 minutes for a table (this place is deceiving large) and ordered two margaritas on the rocks. Holy shitballs mom- those things were STRONG! Even after a full meal (I only had 1 margarita) I could feel the buzz. Was it the best margarita ever? No. Not even close. Was it bad? No. Best Marg in the city still goes to Velvet Cantina.

Anywho, our server was SUPER nice. The third girl showed up a little late, and he had no problem letting us sit at our table and just wait. Ok, time for food reviews.

Chips and Salsa- our server brought three types of salsa- and one of them was HOT. The other two were on the chunkier side, and tasted pretty standard. (Though they did make the doubt if they were made in the actual restaurant.)

I ordered the Enchiladas Verdes plate. It was fine, but it didn't blow my socks off. 

I'd come back to Tia's in a pinch, but the whole experience was A-V-E-R-A-G-E. 

On a sidenote: I could taste garlic well into the next day. I'm not sure what was so garlicky, but I hate the aftertaste!
author: Annalise F.

description: They told me they were closed over an hour before the close time of 11pm. Really inconvenient. Should update their hours on Yelp.
author: Greg H.

description: Ok, so we ate here about 14 years ago and hated it. Nothing pisses me off more than overpriced crappy Mexican food, talking to you too Tommy's!  So we gave this joint another shot since we live in the neighborhood and we lack good Mexican food around here, still talking to you too Tommy's!  Once again we were let down with sorry excuse for Mexican food and an expensive tab, sucks because I wanted it to be good for convenience of not having to roll to the mission for Mexican grub, but no dice!  Negative stars for this place, and you too Tommy's!  You guys should be ashamed of yourselves, or commended for shamelessly ripping off locals for years!  You got me twice in 16 years, no mas suckas!!
author: Ernest M.

description: Strange joint, terrible food quality and taste. Bad margaritas. I really wish this town had some good casual Mexican sit down restaurants. We have given this place three tries and they have all disappointed us. The third time, we did not bother to order past the appetizer and margarita round. Gordon Ramsey, where are you! Something is really off with this joint!
author: Patufla P.

description: This is a great little neighborhood place. The margaritas are strong and the food portions are huge. Great place to go to watch some sports and be slowly induced into a food coma. I tried the tia margarita enchiladas which were amazing. Be prepared to take home some left overs!
author: Mamta B.

description: The food overall is fairly bland. It was fine and edible, but not particularly interesting. The staff is very friendly and it is a fun place to grab a drink, but not worth the cost for dinner!
author: Caitlin P.

description: Overpriced, small portions of gringo-style, mediocre food. They can't even make good cheese enchiladas or truly hot salsa. The pasty refried beans taste canned and the scrimpy combo plate salad has a watery, flavorless dressing. Finding parking is a nightmare. Not worth the trip. Unfortunately, the best Mexican restaurants in San Francisco closed years ago.
author: Pam J.

description: Anyone looking for Southern California style Mexican with good portions, plates of food, quality food, and plenty of different things to try.  Salsa was not the best and can be improved but the rest gave it a bump to 5 stars.  I enjoyed the 1970's ambiance and think local, hole in the walls places should look like this..  A recommendation for anyone living in or visiting San Francisco, from a San Franciscan.
author: Adam S.

description: We recently moved to a new city and my heart yearns for Tia Margarita.  You were our goto place for great Mexican food in SF. Fantastic food, stiff drinks, friendly wait staff.  I really miss you Tia Margarita!!
author: Gregory W.

description: The margaritas were out of control strong, but in a good way. Love this spot.
author: Ari F.

description:
My hubby and I LOVE this place. It's our favorite spot to watch a giants game. The bartenders are awesome, and the margies are even BETTER! Best margarita in the City. Too strong????? The people reviewing are crazy. It's supposed to taste like tequila, not sweet and sour. Bring me the double! ;)

We always dine at the bar, because it's the best place to see the game and chat with the bartenders. Guests at the bar are always so nice, and you can tell that this place is stocked with regulars. They're doing it right! 

Their food always comes out hot. Love the tacos and fajitas. Guacamole is a must!
author: Valerie A.

description: Worst "food" iv had, ever, in San Francisco. If you plan on eating here drink at least three margaritas, don't order a michelada, or the chicken wings with spicy "sauce." Never going back.
author: Whuan E.

description: Decent service, average margaritas and Mexican traditional cuisine. I like more fresh flavor than the canned products and the drinks were a bit sweet bit it was a good time and good service.
author: Zara S.

description:
Mexican food in the Outer Richmond...nice old school atmosphere and the portions are big.  Great limey margaritas, squeezed fresh - the way it should be, none of that cheap mix you get at other places.

And it's always a trip to see a priest you recognize from the nearby catholic church sipping on a margarita while waiting for his food...trippy!
author: Emy B.

description:
I ordered enchiladas with sour cream and a double top shelf margarita.

Every single item on my plate was tasteless. I had to use the salsa that came with the chips for flavor.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Tia's makes me happy.

Sit at the bar - try to be on the eastern side - you'll be served by Francisco, and he hooks you up.

Order a few margs and eat too many chips w/ salsa.

Get a large plate of food and eat too much - sure, you'll feel it the next day, but it's worth it.

Look, Tia's doesn't deserve 5 stars for the food - it's relatively average hot-plate Mexican IMO. Tia's excels in the experience - this is a great neighborhood spot with awesome folks on both sides of the bar! Happy warm service, strong margs, and food that hits the spot - what else do you want?
author: Bill R.

description: Tia's is my home away from home, I'm here at least once a week with family and friends. The service is always amazing and the margaritas and food are perfection. It's a hidden gem in the Richmond, and there are many reasons why it's been here for over 50 years.
author: jenn f.

description:
Alright, I'll cut right to the chase.

Do not bother eating here.  The food is mediocre.  Pretty bland, most dishes have a soggy texture, all around pretty blah.   The only time I order food here is if I have had entirely too much to drink and need something to soak up some alcohol.  (You're far better off just walking a block or few to another neighborhood joint).

However, the margaritas are awesome!  All those people lining up at Tommy's down the street just don't know...  margaritas at Tia's are made as they should be.  No bottled mixes, just tequila, triple sec, fresh limes, ice.  

Staff is friendly, service is very quick, I love sitting at the bar and having a few.  They also do the most hilariously kitschy Cinco de Mayo events you could hope for.  Ask me some time about bobbing for jalapenos and my "I survived Cinco de Mayo" t-shirt (hint: I would not say I 'survived').
author: Heidi M.

description:
As a SoCal native I've been trying to find a decent Mexican establishment and when this one was recommended I was so excited that I'd potentially find my Mexican spot in SF and this definitely was not it. I went on a Friday night and mind you it's a really busy night but it took us an hour to get our food with no updates from our waiter. Our waiter was MIA and I constantly had to hound whoever was around to ask to refill our drinks. When we finally got our food it was mediocre to say the least. I ordered the enchiladas and the sauce was so terrible it tasted like bland tomato and had no flavor to it. If I had to rate this restaurant solely based on food I would give it 2 stars but the reason why I'm giving this establishment one star is because I'm so disappointed by the service. 

My guest had strict religious practices where they are unable to consume beef. Half-way through eating their 'chicken dish' my guest noticed that there were chunks of beef in the 'chicken' dish. We immediately asked to speak to a manager and when my guest stated that they were highly offended by the beef in their dish due to religious practices, the manager rudely said 'that's chicken, there's no beef.' I had to pull out the chunks of beef and put them on the side of the plate to show her that there was in fact beef in the dish. And even still, she questioned the fact that it was beef. SO RUDE. The manager's questioning of our rightful accusation was rude and not customer service-oriented at all. Instead of addressing the offensive nature of what had just occurred, she repeatedly insisted we order something else. Why would we want to order anything else when you've lost all the trust of your customer by not taking their concern seriously? At that point, we were so irritated that we asked for the bill, paid, and left. I will never be returning here again.
author: Lissette L.

description: I first went to this place 20 years ago and loved it.  It is equally good now.  If you like the kind of Mexican food that includes tacos, enchiladas, guacamole and fresh salsa, this is a great place.  Watch out, it will be full of people, including lots of families.  Everyone loves it, so you may have a wait.  You can't go wrong here and the drinks are terrific -- very generous.  Plus, the prices are reasonable.
author: Nancy R.

description: Forewarning: we are San Diegan Mexican Food snobs. That said, the plates were fairly untouched and the wait staff didn't notice it. It's ok in a pinch as a sit down spot, but stick to the chips and margaritas.
author: Margret H.

description:
not gonna lie...I got trashed here!
The Margaritas are strong folks....especially if you're drinking doubles like my ass was. Which makes it hard to participate in the Trivia night [first Thursday of each month] that they have. The food is yummy and the portions are huge. I thoroughly enjoyed the enchiladas with shrimp.  It's a great date spot or just to hang out with some friends. I think they have a happy hour as well [but don't quote me]
author: Natalie F.

description:
Hit & Miss Mexican food (stick to basic staples) but probably the best authentic margaritas in California (no mix).

UPDATE: I am adding a star since I found some of the food to be excellent. Stick to the basic Mexican staples like tamales, burritos and enchiladas which are very good. The empanadas are terrible, the taquitos, carne asada and rice are very average. The fajitas are very good but you only get maybe 3 oz. of steak.

Summary:
-----------------
I give it 4 overall stars: 5 stars for the margaritas, 5 for the bar staff service/attitude but 3 1/2 stars average for food (some great, some meh). I also give it 2 stars for waitress service/attitude (the old lady is the worst) and 3 for the business hours (they close at 10:30 Fridays!). Did I mention the margis rule???


Full Review:
-------------------
I have eaten here a few times and was disappointed with the Mexican food the first few times, having grown up in San Diego and been weaned on the best. After 12 years in SF I know there is much better Mexican restaurants around (La Barca and Tortilla Heights are two great ones) and even many better taquerias (La Taqueria and Nick's are epic). But the basic staples I have discovered to be very good. What has always kept me coming back (probably 15 times now) is the ultra friendly bartender (manager?) Francisco and his truly authentic margaritas. 

The margaritas here are made using only good quality silver tequila, cointreau triple sec and fresh lime juice (so no sugary mix). I rarely drink margaritas because those made with the sweet and sour mix give me brutal heart burn but I have no problem taking down a few authentic margaritas and quite enjoy those served here. Just one of the jumbo margis will smack you in the face and two will make you delightfully toasted and much smarter, funnier and better looking. 

The other cool thing about the place is that most of the patrons (like myself) are locals from the Richmond/Seacliff neighborhoods so on a Friday night you see lots of familiar faces. 

The only other bummer is the place has limited hours (they close at 10:30 Friday and they do not open on weekends until 4PM!). WTF? Anyways, if you go for the margis and basic Mexican staples. Also, definitely sit at the bar as Francisco (the more outgoing, mexi-beach bum bartender) is much friendlier and efficient than the wait staff I have experienced.
author: Mike L.

description: The food is horrible ("chef's special" was burned to a crisp) and the drinks mediocre. When we complained about our margaritas, the hostess/manager argued with us as if we were just trying to get a discount. This place has gone DOWNHILL.
author: James P.

description: Food is terrible. Being Mexican, this is not how you make Mexican food. Taste like a step up from Taco Bell. Sorry. But it's try and most of my friends make a face when ever this place is mentioned for an option...haha it's that bad. Margaritas are ok. Pricey, but I can still enjoy them so they get a star for that.
author: mel l.

description: The service is horrible you have to know this going in, but they pour very strong and very good fresh margaritas. A couple of those baby's and you'll be feeling a nice buzz no doubt. The food is pretty standard Mexican food but I really enjoyed my meal, I had the chicken enchiladas with a fried egg on top. Highly recommend the fried egg made for an excellent touch. Seems like the place is always busy with locals which is a good sign. Would give more stars if the service was a little friendlier.
author: Zino M.

description:
This place is alright.

Cute and classic, but the food is definitely nothing special. If anything, it's extremely salty and quite expensive for what it is. Yeah the margaritas can be strong-ish, but if you ask me, they are small (TONS of ice) and expensive too. My main qualm with this place really is that it seems to cost a lot more than it should. 

I've also found the staff to be quite unfriendly and impatient. Every time we have eaten here they seem more annoyed than anything that they have to be there at all. They are especially grumpy toward the end of the night, but i'm sorry, if your kitchen is open, it's open. And if it's not, it's not. But when it is open and you are still treating my late dinner as a total inconvenience for you when this is supposed to be the service you provide it doesn't really make me want to get my burrito dinner here.
author: Theresa C.

description:
DO NOT GO HERE FOR CINCO DE MAYO, OR EVER

ASSAULT BY BARTENDER, BANK FRAUD

SHIT SCUM OF A BUSINESS

AND MANAGER SIMPLY DOES NOT GIVE A SHIT

I was nearly assaulted by the bartender here, who was clearly drunk, for asking
a simple question about the margaritas. I was not drunk, I had just gotten there n had a burrito.
To top this all off, I paid my bill and left (looking back I shouldnt have paid shit, and
called the police instead). When the manager came, she didnt care that her bartender
had jus nearly assaulted me, all she cared was for me to pay the bill and get out of there.
All she kept saying was "wheres his check wheres his check" are you fucking kidding me? I was in a really good calm mood, so this whole time I was extremely calm, almost too calm now looking back. After I told her what happened she didnt care at all! The bartender rushed to the bathroom and started washing his mouth, then he came drunkenly to the manager saying "look im not drunk look im not drunk" wtf... then 2 mexicans who were usually cooks or bus boys followed me to the door, bouncer style LoL. To top this all off, when I checked my bank a week later, they had charged me literally TWICE MY BILL. What in the FUCK?!!?!? I called my bank and disputed it of course.

Again, I really wish I called the police and filed a police report. There has to be a law against serving alcoholic beverages and being wasted yourself. And also, of course there are laws against assault. I might contact ABC later. Fuck you Tia Margarita.
author: Belito L.

description:
I have to agree with the bad reviews here for the food.

I hadn't eaten here in years although I've lived in the Richmond District since 1977.  I should have stayed away.

I'm giving it 2 stars instead of one because my dining companions had margaritas which they said were excellent.

 We were there around 6 on a Friday and had to wait about ten minutes, not bad and I thought since it was so busy it must be good.  We were put in a room with 5 tables and the other 4 tables all had children at them, One was having a birthday party for a one year old.   So if you have kids this may be the place for you.  The food is very bland, so kids probably like that. It was very noisy even without the children and all the kuds made it worse as when one quieted down another would start shrieking.

My companions ordered their margaritas but after finishing them, the waiter never asked if they'd like another.  This was in spite of the fact that our table was right next to a little window to the bar where all the waiters picked up the drinks.  So they had to ask him when he came by to pick up another order.

The food took a long time to come and although they said the plates were hot they were not.  I ordered enchiladas rancheros without beans so I can't comment on those.  The rice tasted and looked  like plain white rice with fake butter.  There was no Mexican seasoning to it at all.  The salad was huge, just shredded lettuce with tasteless salsa.  Huge portions of rice and salad compared to the size of the enchiladas.  The cheese on top of the enchiladas was melted but the inside cheese was not.  The onions and peppers on top of the enchiladas were huge chunks, a little dicing might have helped.

No one ever came and refilled the water, I had to ask for more water and it took a while for him to bring more.  We had to ask the waiter for the check after our plates had been cleared for at least 15 minutes.  Then he never came back to take the credit card, after another 15 minutes I went looking for him in the hallway where they were coming out with the food.  I couldn't find him so I just gave it to another waiter, the hostess ended up bringing it back to us.

Our waiter spent quite a bit of time laughing and visiting with two others parties in our room, but I guess since we were not regulars he no time for us.

I will not be back.

I guess if you like their margarites have some at the bar.
author: Madeline M.

description:
Margaritas are kinda hard to fuck up, since there (should) only be  three ingredients.  So, I'm not judging them on that - they're strong, good, and will get you whammered. HOWEVER!

the food is a pretty poor excuse for mexican. the salsa tastes like ketchup, everything else is just kind of limp and uninspired. i think this food would be ok at two am after like six margs, but not to start your night. I don't think they're even open that late. stay for the booze, skip the food.  it's sad, too, because this hood could use some great mexican.
author: Colin B.

description:
Well, the decor was alright.  
We were treated rudely by the bartender, the food was both too salty (beans and margaritas (seriously, it got in the drinks, not just the rim, bleh)) and too bland (chicken enchilada), and I think their tamales are made with wallpaper paste (couldn't get through two bites). Ugh.
author: Marie J.

description: My husband and I keep coming here and I don't know why, oh yeah....Margaritas. Service can be very sketchy. Hostess is always great, she even helped take orders for server that seemed overwhelmed. Food is good nothing spectacular. We get the empanadas, tostada salad or the fajitas. I wish they kept fresh jalapeños or serranos in the back. How do you make salsa without jalapeños??? If you come. Come for the margaritas, get some food and don't expect much on trend of service. If you get the abuelita .....run...fast
author: Sabrina M.

description:
Tia's Rocks!
I can't believe I haven't reviewed it yet because I've eaten here at least 10 times.  I've been with friends, family, co-workers, everyone loves this place.  First thing you need to know is that the food is TASTY!  We've probably gone thru everything on the menu at this point and have never been disappointed.   It's one of our favorite places to eat in the city.

The portions are HUGE!  My wife and I will go and split a large combination plate (which gives you a choice of 3 items - tamale, burrito, enchilada, chile relleno, etc.).  It's perfect because you can try a bunch of stuff and it's only around $15.  Not only have we both been full off of that plate, but we can still bring leftovers home for another meal.  Rockin'!  

My buddy ordered a small combination plate and that came with TWO burritos!  Nice.  I read where some people were bitching about the prices, but, the food you get will feed an army.

Next, the Margaritas are great.  We had a group of 5 there tonight and everyone commented on how tasty they were.  I read a few reviews where people felt they were watered down, but I've never thought that once in all the Margaritas I've had there over the years.  In fact, sometimes I thought they were TOO strong.  (I mean, it can't really ever be TOO strong, but, ya know what I mean). 

The wait staff there is great.  We had chips and salsa on our table within moments of being seated.  They're quick to fill back up your water, they're generous with the chips and salsa and constantly come around to make sure you have everything you need.  After years of going, I finally introduced myself to the same waitress who has waited on us so many times.  Her name is Rosa and she's awesome.  She's got a great sense of humor and we love joking around with her.  I already can't wait to go back....
author: dave g.

description:
Dear old-wobbly-lady,

WTF? You're the WORST WAITRESS IN THE ENTIRE WORLD. That is NOT a hyperbole. Scene breakdown. The hostess was very nice, but upon being seated, you went from bad to worse. You couldn't comprehend that I wanted 2 waters to start because my cohort was away from the table when I ordered drinks. You got my order wrong, but I didn't say anything because it looked delicious and you were old. As the night went on, you kept running into my chair as you hobbled past the table. Never once did we get refills on our water (but you did finally comprehend why I wanted two glasses of water....) 

When you brought us the bill, you came back thirty seconds later and muttered the word "Collect?" WHO ARE YOU, A BILL COLLECTOR? You then proceeded to whisper in my ear "We have people waiting for your table." Okay, I get it. You're busy and need my table. We're collecting our money. Calm down.

You then took our check. It had money in it. But no tip. Typically, I'm very generous toward those working in the service industry. I too work in the service industry and understand that their jobs suck. Well, unfortunately for you, we didn't feel you were deserving of one. But what did you do after that? You ASKED US WHY YOU DIDN'T GET A TIP. It was the most awkward experience of my short life. You even dug around on the table top looking for cash while we were standing there getting our jackets on. If our lack of tip wasn't justified beforehand, it certainly was now. 

Alas, the food was delicious, as always, and for that, Tia Margarita, you earn 4 stars. Just fire that stupid old weeble. She can collect Social Security now.

Sincerely,

The Un-tipper.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
This place was jumping on Friday night. 

After a reception at the deYoung, we decided to go over to Tia Margarita and have some fun. This was the culmination of years' worth of My Lady's raving about the place. When we walked through the door we discovered the place was packed. Three dining rooms or more, and nearly every seat was filled. 

We started off by ordering a couple of margaritas, naturally. Then I ordered the appetizer sampler, and My Lady ordered her current favorite, flautas. While I found that by the end of the sampler plate it seemed like I was eating an endless plate of flour tortillas, My Lady said the flautas were the best she'd ever had. We settled the bill at $59 + a generous tip, because our waiter was truly interested in making sure we had a good time. 

While we had different opinions about the food, we both agreed that the people-watching was outstanding.
author: David D.

description: 5 stars, not for the food (which is excellent), not for the drinks (which are iconic) but the for the geniuses behind the bar.  They are part 6 sigma and part ballet.  Go watch them.  Very Zen.  Let me know when you agree.
author: Jeff J.

description: My first time soooooo great! Tiny but cozy. Margaritas were amazing! Defiantly go with the double house. Food was great, very quick And they they had the Giants  game on, with volume.
author: Kati V.

description:
The first time I visited this establishment, we were denied because it was 10:40pm and they close at 11:00pm. It was interesting because the hostess gave us a table but a waitress came over and said "No, no. We are closed. The kitchen is closed." No apologies, just flat out denial. 

"If at first you don't succeed, dust yourself off and try again." Right? Right. So now I'm back and this time we arrived earlier and were seated right away. We sat in the back of the restaurant which was quite disappointing because the room was too dark. I struggled to read the menu and enjoy the food since our table was only lit by a tiny candle. One star down.

When it came to the food, the chips and salsa were a-ok. The salsa tasted like a fusion of canned tomatoes and ketchup, which I can assure you is not a good combination. Two stars down. However, the green salsa was good and extra spicy. The chips were super crunchy and highly addictive. 

For starters, we had the chicharrones and I felt it was overpowered with cumin. It was crispy but too salty. The gambas al ajillo (shrimp with garlic and butter sauce) was good but nothing special. It's paired with flour tortillas and that made it fun to eat. 

On to the main courses. We had enchiladas, tamales, tacos, and flautas. What a disappointment. The dishes were bland and tasteless. We had to add salt to every single serving and that is a no, no in my book.  Although the portions are big, it did not make up for the mediorce options on the menu. Three stars down.

As for service, our waitress was very sweet and attentive. She always made sure we had our refills on drinks, tortillas, and chips and salsa. We didn't try their margaritas but overheard from the two tables next to us that they were "pretty damn strong." Too bad I won't be coming back to give you an updated review on that.

I should of known that it wasn't meant for me to try the food here when we were already denied the first time around. That was a sign and I should of trusted it instead of shopping for a restaurant on an empty stomach.
author: Chau H.

description:
Excellent food and service. I ordered to go and it was hot and fresh. The people were courteous despite some previous reviews. 

Excellent chips and some of the freshest guacamole I've had in a while. 

Combo plate is a great deal. The food is not greasy here.

The only thing I'd change is they don't serve the standard Spanish rice, but overall a great place. 

I plan on returning for a Margarita to sit at the horseshoe shaped bar. Looks like a fun place for a drink and dinner after work. The crowd is pleasant and easy going. Great location since I can walk there within a minute. Love it.
author: Cherie F.

description: Went last week , I would not recommend this place , to me the chicken enchiladas had no flavor at all. I have tasted better. A waste of my money but never again.
author: Janet V.

description:
Oh my. What can I say. Okay, fantastic salsas for the chips. Really. The margaritas are just okay and incredibly strong. The drunken group sitting at the table next to us kept reminding us of this. 
The food...well it was just okay and way overpriced. The carne and pollo asada were incredibly bland. Oh but I should add that the garlic sauce used for the shrimp was superb. But who serves rice pilaf at a Mexican restaurant? 
It was incredibly loud there and very busy.  I doubt I would go back to be honest. Just not worth it.
author: Paula E.

description:
if you're looking for some mexican restaurant that'll do the trick without having to go to the mission and wrestle with parking, this would be the place. portions are large so please consider sharing an order. service was good with our waiter, an older gentleman, being pretty attentive and was very detailed about setting up the placing for the other table even though it was just a cloth napkin and silverware... he's trying. 

had the chips and salsa that's complementary -- good chips, nice and thin like restaurant tortilla chips should be! (not thick and hard); their spicy salsa has a kick and their non-spicy is good. i mixed my eating with 1 bite of spicy with 4 bites of non-spicy. i'd advise you do the same!

my friend's margarita (upgraded to patron) was very strong (per friend's account.) my water was just fine. never empty.

i got my some steak fajitas and they were a-ok. i'm used to tex-mex with the iron cast skillet being brought out and my fajita sizzling. their flour tortillas are good -- thin, chewy, the way it should be. guar was pretty good. didn't skimp out on my pico or my lettuce or my sour cream. :D :D :D i love my onions and bell peppers that were with my meat. 

my friend raves about the rice and beans. i thought they were good, as well. friend had the crispy tacos and initially gave it the stinkeye with its questionable red sauce but then she really liked it... the enchilada wasn't extra cheesy like good ol' tex mex but i also didn't hear my friend rave about that, either. she left the tamales alone so i'm not certain if she didn't care for them or just couldn't make it around to it.

we felt pretty crappy after that meal. neither of us finished and it was a mistake to over-indulge. obviously this has nothing to do with the quality of the food or the service but just a warning to all that you may suffer this fate should you indulge here like we did.
author: Vicki T.

description:
Went to Tia Margarita for dinner after being recommended by a friend and must say not bad at all for being outside the mission district. The food portions are great for the price, margaritas we're not all that great watered down. About the restaurant it's nice and clean and a bit dark if you sit in the back, customer service was not all that great our waitress was not to familiar with some items on the menu.

But over all I gave it a three star rating would had given it a 4 if our waiter was not bouncing all over the place. I would defiantly visit if I were in the area again.
author: Artie T.

description: awesome margaritas, Maybe best in sf. Fresh lime juice and potent tequila. Got the sampler platter which was huge and impossible to finish with less then three people. Good service and authentic atmosphere. Bartender gave farewell shots on the way out. Will be back very soon. :)
author: Jake C.

description:
Tia Margarita is basically a terrible restaurant.

The hostess is downright rude, and dresses like a schlep.

From the minute we sat down, we had to wait 10 minutes to order drinks.
Another 5 or so to receive them, then another 5minutes to order the food, which came out RIGHT AWAY.  Then another 10 minutes waiting to get our credit cards back from the bill.......with no pen in the sleeve.  

The staff is simply disorganized and flustered.  The margaritas are not terrible, but the only thing authentic about them is the glass they are served in. 

And the food.  Ah yes, the food; tex mex at best.  Its like deep fried mayonaise and mushy pinto beans from a can.  ERLACK! And it makes you very thirsty. 

God I hate this place.
author: Bret O.

description:
I don't even really know where to start, but here goes:

1. Worst Margarita I've ever had - Don't get me wrong, I like them strong, but this was over the top disgusting.  It was 95% tequila.  I guess if you are interesting in getting hammered on the cheap, this may be a positive thing...

2. The "rice" - I've never had neon yellow, overly salted Mexican rice like this.  I liken it to a nice top-self Rice A Roni...

3. Everything was overly salty, like inedible salty.  Anyone cooking that food should be ashamed.

4. Ordered chicken, got a strange ground beef mixture instead (with a very strange non-beef greasy flavor).  Waited 10 minutes to finally get the waiter's attention, only to have him not believe I actually ordered chicken.  He promptly checked my story by checking the order he wrote down.  "Oh, I see here you did order the chicken!  Did they not give you chicken?"  

5. Salsa comes in "super hot out of the jar" and "probably spaghetti sauce of the the jar"

Unless you are interesting in taking a trip back in time to an authentically-unauthentic-Mexican-restaurant-circa-small-town-America-1982, drive 15 minutes to the Mission and get some real food.  Unless of course you want to get f-ed up on some cheap, awful margaritas and get your week's worth of salt intake.  

I'm not sure what I was thinking trying to have Mexican food in the Richmond, but never again.  NEVER AGAIN!
author: Jenny M.

description: I love this place! Classic sit down Mexican is hard to find in SF...let alone the Richmond. This place is consistently delicious and their margaritas make any other look shameful. Non traditional Mexican bar, more restaurant vibe in the back. Antonio is the best waiter, try to sit in his section :). Great city gem.
author: Jaclyn B.

description: Happy Hour Margarita? not so much!  We had two margaritas for about $18!  How is that HH? And we were there around 430pm on a weekday. Oh, I can make way better margarita than this bartender..NO alcohol taste what so ever. it was so sour. yuck.... what a waste of time and money.
author: Alyce l.

description:
This is a casual family restaurant where the chile rellenos and the margaritas are really good. This is not the place for an intimate meal. On the other hand, you won't be spending a fortune for dinner.

The salsa is nice and spicy, and the chips keep coming. One thing I wish they'd serve is Green Pork Chile. Prepare for a bit of a wait on the weekend.
author: Monarch B.

description:
Let me start by saying I'm a fan of Tex-Mex. One thing I have noticed in all of the Bay Area is the tortillas are made all wrong...they are supposed to be fluffy, not hard!

Anywhosinhowsin, this place is on par with most other Mexican joints in the City, not my favorite by any means...sure the Margarita's are good, but it's hard to make a bad Margarita. 

I gave this place the benefit of the doubt and went either 2 or 3 times total. Unfortunately, I can't say that I'll be going again. I'd, seriously, rather go to Chevy's 

*burp*
author: Jennifer P.

description:
The food is OK, the main attraction obviously is the horseshoe-shaped bar. We prefer to sit on the eastern half, the margaritas are better, and the service on the other side is of the grumpy kind.

It is still a favorite neighborhood hang-out, without the seediness often associated with bars. The drinks are top, and there's plenty of folks to connect with!
author: Wolfgang S.

description:
Homey, friendly, OK food. 

Pricing is higher than I would have expected  for a Mexican restaurant. 
Food is kinda just OK. It is a definite locals joint, since I went w/ "locals" service was great. I kept wondering if  they make the Margarita's strong to dull the feeling that the food is just OK....not really bad, but not really great.  

Not a tamale by tamale, taco by taco, sip by sip report....see the other ones for that.  Ima not an Inner Richmand dweller but know good  Mex. food when I taste it....see other reviews for other places ! 

Won't be back soon.
author: Matsuo U.

description:
Tia Margarita is definitely an established locale here in the Outer Richmond. As long as I've been living/working in SF, I've always heard about this place as a must-try from friends and coworkers alike. 

So just yesterday, my friends and I decided to check out Tia Margarita and compare it to Tommy's over on Geary.

The place was busy as I expect it would given it's popularity and longevity in the neighborhood. 

Although the chips and salsa were delivered fast, we had to endure a bit of wait for a server to come by to take our drink or menu order. I think it was about 8 minutes or so---at least enough time for us to finish the chips and salsa. 

After the order was put in, the turnaround time from the kitchen to our table was fast. But this is where things get dicey. We asked for refills on our sodas; not the margaritas (get to this later) and was told there is an additional charge for this. Wow, an additional charge for soda that is money maker for the place. Ok, so we balked on that hidden charge up. 

The margaritas are okay--nothing to write home about. It's like they used a pre-margarita mix and added the final tequila shot or something. Tommy's version is definitely hands down the winner here folks. 

All in all, the pricing and service leaves something to desire IMHO. For our money and for a guaranteed good time, we'll seek other places like Tommy's a few blocks up.
author: Jessie M.

description:
Tia Margarita is my favorite local Mexican restaurant in the Richmond Dist. 

But we go for the strong top-shelf Margaritas and stay for the delicious food. Tommy's may have the rep for being the margarita place but their food, well... Tia Margarita has both! Excellent food and strong yummy margaritas (I've learned my limit is one double). My bf just had some great garlicky prawns last weekend at Tia that blew our minds. I always order the beef tacos with side of black beans, rice, salad that never disappoints.

Oh and the chips...it's like two bowls isn't even enough.
author: Kira B.

description:
authentic mexican's food is what I live for. the employees at the Taco Bell/KFC know me by name and as my Chipotle review suggests, I have  gotten a taste for all things south of my border. Came here after hearing co-workers discuss their evening plans to try this place, and they were happily surprise to see me, I think! 

that's where the dream was smashed. This place was not making me feel like a vacation, no. This place was making me feel weird. The waitress was crypt keeper like and my food was nothing like i wanted, it was more like tasteless glop from a bathroom. 

****that is not to say that a bunch of packets of tacobell hot sauce wouldn't save the dish*****

maybe this could be a good kitchen nightmares episode
author: Merland S.

description:
There is simply nothing to report about Tia Margarita that hasn't been said in any previous review.

As someone else mentioned, the food isn't terrible, it's just not worth traveling across town for.

Special note for the kitchen: Back off the salt!
author: Christopher B.

description:
I came here with a few friends last night and we all agreed that this place just isn't up to par. In fact, its just bad. My chimichanga was a low 3 stars. It was fairly soggy and the beans were burnt and dry. VERY burnt. My friend's toastda salad was an easy 2 stars, nothing impressive or tasty about it at all. And his little brothers chicken wings were just disgusting, and for some reason, came with soy sauce. It made no sense at all. The service was also poor. I had asked for tortillas and a ginger ale. I didn't receive either and went the whole meal without anything to drink. Not even a glass of water.

The highlight of the meal was the one black olive placed on top of my chimichanga. Ironically enough my friend agreed.
author: David D.

description: Our fist visit a couple of weeks ago, left us thinking, "Hmm, Magaritas were good, food was great, but the staff was rude!"  But we thought it was because it was a busy night, and we would give it another try.  Second visit last night, "I walked in before my husband, the bar was buzzing, the bartender used the old trick: If-I-don't-make-eye-contact-You-don't-exist.
