This place was disgusting! I would never return. I heard that it is the cocktails that make this place, well whoop-de-doo, I know where to go to find cocktails and it ain't this place.
author: Jack G.

description: Calling marinara sauce salsa should be a crime.
author: Kim S.

description:
keep in mind that i read the other reviews and stayed objective during the entire process...  

of course i know the rule:
1. you're going to be full after eating at a mexican restaurant

but i'm full of sub-par food.
this place reminds me of mexican food in the midwest.
i guarantee you, readers!  if you're planning on going to this place, remember that the people who've given this restaurant bad reviews know what they are talking about.

as for the margaritas:
i have no idea what these people are talking about.
the only decent thing about them was that they were cheap; but they were made cheap, and did NOT taste good.  i asked the bartender if they had a menu, or options for the margaritas (not a completely absurd question)... and he thought i was insane.

+ he told me that they only had a few options, of which "top-shelf" was not mentioned, even though they have decent (don julio) tequila in the joint.

of course, there are much better margaritas to be had.

all in all, i think i've decided that most of the positively inclined reviewers here grew up in naive neighborhoods and never left them.  it seems to me that they don't know what good food is because they've never left their comfort zone to get it.

similar to sausalito and mill valley.

ironically enough, the pictures in this page look better than the actual food tastes.  i'm giving 2 stars because there is a sort of home-town vibe about the place, and it's somewhat fun to be there since it's community-driven.  but this is SF!  it should be.  

i'm def going to the mission or thereabouts next time.
author: linden d.

description:
I've been to Tia Margarita's plenty of times before with 3 to 4 star ratings.  This time was the WORST experience.  I came with a party of 12 and I was only staying for drinks and Appetizers with my kids, so I asked if I could have a separate tab. I know most places hate that, so I was prepared for a big fat no.  However, she proceeded to flap her arms around like a chicken in distress, stating that I was being too complicated.  I told her fine, I understand, I would go to the bar.  She stared me down like I was an idiot.  And then she kept staring...and staring...so I told her again that I would just go to the bar, forget my drink. And she stared.  I could get  up and go, since I was squished in the corner so we continued this staring contest until I said it again, in Spanish (my 2nd language).  This pissed her off even more & she said she understood me but she finally left.  I got up and my 2 drinks in a jiffy but my poor party didn't get theirs until I was starting my 2nd.  I was so pissed by this that I went to the hostess to let her know our waitress was extremely rude (I really never complain unless it's really really bad, which it was!)  After I complained, they probably told her and the waitress asked my husband why I was mad at her.  I didn't hear her otherwise I would have told her for sure.  
It also took forever for the food to come - we were seated @ 6:45, and they ordered @ 7:20ish and were served when we were leaving @ 8:10.  The salsa (the only food item I can personally say I ate) was a mix between catsup and a little salt; the "spicy" salsa tasted like bland dirt.  My 2 drinks were the saving grace...The people who did eat said the food was just OK, but will never go back because of the overall experience. Ditto, which sucks because I like to support our neighborhood small business.
author: stephany m.

description:
This place?  It's OK.  Just OK.

It's dark inside, so dark you can barely see your food, which is I guess atmospheric.  There are wraught iron thingies in the fake windows between rooms, some stained glass, and big ol' hanging ceiling of what looks like mirrored glass over the bar.  The whole first dining room is just tables ringed around the bar.  I guess the margaritas are important here.  I didn't have one.

The service was quick and businesslike.  The chips they brought were mostly crunched into small pieces but they were good.  The salsa was like pureed tomatos; very little spice.  Fortunately I like mild salsa so I was pretty happy with it.

I ordered a combo plate with two shredded beef tacos.  The refried beans were not great.  They have this certain taste, maybe it's chili or something but it's a taste I do not like in my beans.  I like my refritos salty and beany.  There was plenty of cheese melted on top of the beans though; I moved the beany cheese over to the rice and ate it together to give it some flavor.  The rice wasn't very much like the spanish rice I'm used to in Mexican restaurants; it was pretty much plain white rice.  So, rice and beans, eh.

The tacos were really good!  The taco shells were just regular pre-folded corn tortillas, the kind you get at the grocery store in a box, but it was OK because the shredded beef was GOOD.  It was the kind of shredded beef that's very flavorful from soaking in salty tomato-y sauce for a long time.  The tacos were covered with some of that salsa-like tomato dressing that Mexican restaurants put on their salads, and a big ol' scoop of guacamole.  Yum!  There was one black olive for garnish.  And the whole shmear was piled atop a big stack of lettuce with tomato dressing.  I couldn't finish all the salad but it was pretty good too.

All in all, this is a decent place to get shredded beef tacos, but not rice and beans, and I'd rather go to Tommy's.  Tommy's was closed tonight which is how I ended up at Tia Margarita's, but I don't know when I'll go back.
author: Lorelei S.

description: Great traditional mexican food! "Jenny's salad" is off the charts! They have the best margarita's in town and the service is great! You know you've found a gem when most of customers are locals that keep coming back for more!!!
author: Robert V.

description: What a find! Food was very good, service was good, margaritas were outstanding.  Small inside and a bit cramped but good food is always worth a little suffering.
author: Jacob C.

description: I went here last night for some Mexican food in the spirit of Cinco de Mayo. This was my first Mexican food experience since returning from living in Mexico City, so I wasn't expecting much outside of the Mission. Well, I was right. We waited about 25 minutes for a table, which wasn't too bad, but then we were seated and practically ignored. When our waitress finally came over, she was less than pleasant. In fact, I don't think the miserable gal smiled once. She seemed annoyed when I asked for extra napkins. I ordered a combination plate and specified that I didn't want tomatoes on antyhing. Imagine my suprise when my food was covered in salsa/tomatoes.... And the food? Eh, it was mediocre Americanized Mexican food--very, very greasy. I probably would not go back there. Even if the food was great, the fact that the waitress was completely miserable turned me off.
author: Amy B.

description:
One star for being a Mexican restaurant in the Richmond, one star for service.

The good: Attentive waiters, speedy service, generally friendly.

The bad: The food was overly salted.  All I could taste is salt whenever I ate something.  This alone brought the place down to two stars.

Overall: go if you need to replenish your sodium in your body.  Otherwise, you're probably better off going towards the ocean on Geary and looking to your left for a better Mexican place.
author: Michael A.

description: They don't serve my favorite dish, but the few I've had have been quite good.  Screw Tommy's.  Just sayin.  Better food here and great margarita's.  The staff is very friendly as well.
author: Kristy K.

description:
best take out mexican food in the city.  owned by an old time SF family..
can't beat the flavor and prices
my kids tell me the margaritas are great there
i'm on my way there now
author: bert k.

description: I love this place. The chips and salsa are amazing. The margaritas are made from scratch, not some crappy mix and I love the chicken tostada. I am always trying to hit up friends to go with me to Tia's. We recently had a bday dinner there for a friend and the service was great and very accomodating.
author: Brooke T.

description: Great food,  large portions, good drinks, and a funny waitress.  I had a great experience here and i will return.
author: Michelle M.

description: Drinking one of Francisco's or Jenny's margaritas is a  San Francisco 'Right of Passage'  You don't get the 'key to the city' until you have done so.   Especially (but not limited to) if it 's Tuesday and Tommy's is closed.  The Chili con Queso is sompin serious, I am not playin.
author: Jay B.

description: It's hard to find good Mexican food outside of the Mission, but a group of us stumbled on this place accidentally and wow, what a cool find. We had 11 people seated in about 40 minutes on a Saturday, and while we waited we drank the strongest margarita I have ever tasted (maybe a little too strong, and not as good as Tommy's nearby). The service was quick and the burritos I had were pretty authentic. I couldn't finish my meal because the portions were sizable and the chips and salsa beforehand were one of a kind.
author: Michael E.

description: Great drinks and good people here! The place is really cute, stained glass windows all around the place. You can tell the regulars dont even have to tell the bartenders what they want, they just sit and are served. I like that.
author: Rachel L.

description: For whatever reason, I never had the impetus to dine at this restaurant even though I grew up in the Richmond District. I'm now making up for lost time as my family first dined here during the Christmas holidays and we were all amazed at the food that this family run restaurant puts out!. I used to be a La Barca fan back when the food was good 20 plus years ago and had been looking for a family style Mexican restaurnat in this neighborhood. The place was still hopping after 9 pm and the margaritas were a killer as many yelpers can attest! I came back a second time within the past month for dinner again and was not dismayed. Portions are large and my wife and mother in law each ordered a single taco with the works and that was plenty for them. On the other hand, I ordered the 3 item combo which included 2 enchiladas and the burrito and was not disappointed. The male server from our first visit remembered me and acknowledged that "we had come back" which was nice. I happened to strike up a conversation with the hostess as I am also in the food business and introduced myself as having been a neighborhood resident. She told me that her parents opened the business back in the 50's which I knew.  I can't remember her name but I will definitely be back when I'm in the city!
author: Richard H.

description: I'm not one to bash a place so this is a first for me....The food in this place sucks!  It has nothing to do with Mexican food....more like garbage.  Good thing their margaritas are off the hook...but the food, my dog won't even eat it.  Sorry Tia Margarita but that was the worse mexican food experience i have ever had.  The waitress we had was really sweet, but i can see in her eyes that she wanted to spit on the food too coz it was just shameful to serve it.
author: Maria B.

description: Went to this place for the first time with my boyfriend on a rainy friday night.  The place is really dim but cozy.   Wasn't in the mood for a cocktail but my boyfriend tried the strawberry margarita, I took a sip and it was pretty good.  I ended up ordering the Flautas for dinner which came with beans, rice and some salad.  The beans and rice were totally bland and the meat coming out of the side of my flautas were black!  Not very appetizing.  My boyfriend got the chimichanga dinner which he said was just alright.  Overall, the food was sub-par, don't know if I'll be back.  Does seem like a popular place for parties, get-togethers and for families.
author: Jade B.

description: boooo....  I was looking forward to eating here after passing by many times.  But, I was disappointed with the food.  I ordered a standard combo plate.  The portions were huge but the flavor was bland.
author: Dawn P.

description: This place is amazing.  For the past 23 years I have been 100% certain that La Casita, in Fremont, was the best Mexican Food in all of the Bay Area... until now.  Service is perfect, prices are perfect, and the food is beyond perfect.  The margheritas are made with fresh lime, and you can start with two different salsas.  It being only walking distance away makes it even better.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Well, the margaritas aren't as good as at Tommy's, but the service and food are much better.  The ambience is great  -- The round booths are super comfy, and it is a nice treat not to wait hours for a table only to get rushed out minutes after sitting down.  Plus, Tia Margarita is open on Tuesdays, while Tommy's is not.
author: Cara C.

description:
Well I just recently signed up for yelp. If I could change the time stamp for this review, I would. My experience at TM was from several years ago. Too bad I can't review this restaurant for it's food or drinks because that would be the more objective and helpful review... however, it didn't even get that far.

The service was so lousy that we just had to get up and leave. I don't know if this particular waitress is still there (older woman) but when I asked a simple question about which enchilada dish was better (they had 2 or 3 enchilada dishes), she gave me lip for it. She said "Well, I don't know! It's whatever you feel like eating!". She also cut my boyfriend off as he started to speak up in defense of me.

The mention of this restaurant makes my blood boil.
author: S. S.

description:
This restaurant was absolutely horrible.

Ordered 2 combination plates
Tamale with beef
Chile Releno
Enchilada beef
Re fried beans
and the second
Tamale with chicken
Enchilada beef

First  we ordered a their premium Margarita on the sweet side. Out came the chips with spicy and mild salsa. The spicy was hot, with no flavor and the mild was good.

The server came back after about 10 min to take our orders. We ordered and 30 min and 3 bowls of chips later she comes to tell us that shes going to check on our food. Absolutely ridiculous how does someone forget about their patrons like that. She came out to apologize, and we waited another 10 min for the food.

The food was so bland, that the rice was the best tasting thing out of the meal. The Enchilada's meat tasted like it was soaked in water, and Tamale had no flavor even drenched in that so called sauce they have. The Chile Releno was only ok. After eating that all I wanted to do was leave BUT was again stopped from leaving because our server disappeared into the other room talking to other customers who were her friends, and for some reason the other waitress was useless and couldn't bring us our check. After she brought us the check, I paid cash and she walked to the back and then started to use the phone and took her sweet time coming back.

Horrible food, horrible service, and food not worth the price.

We left paying $55, we should have went to Chevy's.
author: Dave W.

description: This place is a great place to go if you want a real authentic mexican meal. The margaritas are also very very good. Order the large drink. You will not be dissapointed in the drinks or the food.
author: Michael R.

description: Don't bother going here. With all the great Mexican restaurants around, we're not sure how this one stays in business. My wife and I started with double margaritas, which when you start with bad tequila and ingredients, makes for a really large, bad drink. Our son ordered lemonade, which after tasting, called barfolaid. The food was flavorless, bland and unfortunately plentiful.
author: Dan D.

description: As someone who grew up in LA I feel I have a pretty good idea of what a good Mexican restaurant is.  SF is great for taquerias but if you want a good sit down meal, good luck. Tia Margarita was just as disappointing as I expected it would be.  Food was bland, chips were stale, prices were through the roof.  I'd rather pay a quarter of the price for tasty Mexican food at a take out place.
author: M M.

description: Tia's is my FAVORITE neighborhood restaurant. The only reason why I haven't given it 5 stars is because, well, it's not a 5 star restaurant. That being said, it is the PERFECT place to get your fix of chips & salsa (ask for the hot stuff) and margaritas. This is what I grew up on on the east coast.  I love the big portions and the no frills menu. It is what it is. They dont try to be creative and turn it into Baja California cuisine. Just good home cookin'. Family owned and operated. These people treat you right. Thank you, Tia's.
author: Heather T.

description: When you live in the Richmond and don't feel like making the trek to the Mission for Puerto Allegre - Tia Margarita's is the fix.  Good margaritas and tasty food.  Way better alternative than Tommy's because the service is SO much better!
author: Godzilla T.

description:
The margaritas don't hold a candle to those of my coveted Tommy's, but that could just be the more copious amounts of tequila that good ole Tom puts in the those darned things. The service was a bit on the hurried and homey style so that was pretty much a buzz kill. I went on a night that wasn't particularly busy, so maybe our waitress thought she'd give us a lot of extra unwarranted attention by hovering over us the entire time. 
The food there is no beuno. The only redeeming part of the food experience happened to the be the free chips and salsa. The rest of the food was greasy and all tasted the same...gross. I supposed the massive amount of grease helps to mop up the alcohol, but I prefer to have good solid yummy food to sop up the mess I have made with my insides. All in all an annoying time by the end of the night...not even remotely redeemable even with Margaritas and I like my drinky drink. You be the judge.
author: Stacy T.

description: The margaritas here are all top shelf! A bit on the expensive side but delicious none the less! The food aint bad either!
author: Bumble B.

description: Really great food.  Went here last night and there was no wait at all (whereas with Tommy you can end up waiting 20 minutes for a table).  I still prefer the margaritas at Tommy's though!
author: Rosie S.

description: Just up 2 blocks from my house this place has a homey feeling because the waitress are so nice and welcoming. Its actually pretty good considering I am not a fan of mexican food. There margaritas are bomb...on the rocks with no salt. Everytime I go there I either order the steak picado or the salad with the fried taco shell if you want something lighter. But the portions are HUGE and could be shared with someone. And of course endless chips and salsa.
author: Jody C.

description:
so, i went to Tia Margarita on Cinco de Mayo. got there early enough to miss a long wait. had a few average margaritas, and some really addictive chips & salsa. 

service is like your friend's mama is serving you some homemade mexican food. so it's comforting, but food was just good, but not mind-blowing. i love that the warm tortillas are accompanied by butter (YUM!) for the fajitas, and the chicken enchiladas were... again, just good. 

all in all, i would go back for a comfortable sit-down mexican meal, but not that often. i'll update my review as i try more dishes.
author: Sharon C.

description: I dig the margaritas here, and the food is pretty solid. Service is on point and the atmosphere is convivial. Watch the beans and the salsa though, they have more onions than you think and you'll have reminders the next day... All in all, a good little spot in the back of inner richmond.
author: Sean Q.

description: The atmosphere is fun, and a big space, but the food was so sub-par. I mean Mexican food is not "hard" cuisine but they seemed to have gentrified it in a bizarre way, I seriously prefer a Chevy's to this place any day.
author: Serene M.

description:
May Tia Margarita live forever. 

It's like the "Mexican" restaurants our parents took us to in the 70's. Heavy on the lard. Huge platters of food. Shredded lettuce everywhere. The "light eater" burrito is the size of any gigantor 'rito from the Mission.

And the Margaritas are delicious. Unfortunately, they don't do pitchers anymore. So make sure you get the double because you'll be wanting more.
author: Sheri E.

description: This place is an old-timer type of place. My friend and I take-out to avoid eating in.  So by food alone it's good but not amazing.  The food is very traditional without too many interesting or innovative dishes.  The Marqueritas are very good (it better be by the name of it :P) but the everything seems rather uninspired.  Nonetheless sometimes it's better to be safe and do things right.
author: Patrick C.

description: I don't know what to say about this place because I've had fantastic meals here and I've had meals I wouldn't feed to my dog.  It just doesn't make sense.  I do love the atmosphere in the bar, however, and the margaritas are always killer.  Bottom line is it just isn't consistent enough to recommend.  Better stick to the Mission District for good authentic Mexican food.
author: Rabbit B.

description: I went here with my boyfriend because my sisters said that it was good.  There seems to be good amount of customers. Sorry to say but all Americans which I don't like to see when I walk in to a non American restaurant. We had the Empanadas which was not good at all. They were not Empanadas.  My boyfriend had the Chile Rellenos which he thought is was just OK. I had Enchiladas Racheras which was not that good at all. The Margarita' are good. My boyfriend ordered one and he said it was nice and strong. I don't think I will ever go back there again just because i could have better Mexican food.
author: Ge I.

description: I had to post this review after reading some of the negative ones just to put my two cents in. I have been going to Tia Margarita for over twenty years, (I miss Virginia, the late owner terribly)  including after I moved to the East Bay because it represents value and a guaranteed good time. I typically bring friend's and family that are in town for a visit and have yet to hear a complaint from anyone. Francisco behind the bar - hooking up the wicked margaritas is worth the trip alone. I am particualrly fond of the Chef's Special combo platter - huge, HOT plate of Pollo Asada, Garlic Prawns and the best Carne Asada (drenched in onions which seem to be cilantro, lime infused - SO GOOD). I seldom wander from this dish unless it's just to get the Carne Asada dinner plate alone. One day I will try something else.....I have another 20 or 30 good years though to get to the rest of the menu. I have never received anything other than exeplary service, though as a long-time customer, that may have something to do with it.  Either way, I don't care. It is my mexican establishment of choice and will remain so until, well hopefully, forever. As a matter of fact - I am driving to the City now - NCAA tournament be damned (that's what DVR's are for).
author: Bill H.

description: Absolutely fantastic chicken enchiladas! The plate came and literally my eyes popped out of my head~the portions were HUGE! I have some great left overs for today, so if headed out with friends or on a date you might want to consider sharing if you aren't starving. The margaritas were decent.  As margaritas aren't my first choice I can't really say whether or not they were ideal. The ambiance was great and the service prompt and accommodating.
author: Stephanie J.

description: Best sit-down Mexican in the city.  Fun bar.
author: Danielle B.

description:
I lived in the Richmond for a long time. I still wonder how this restaurant stays in the business. Perhaps because they own the building.
The bar and the appetizers are the only passable food and drink. 
Don't ever order Carne Asada dinner. It is a poorly tenderized cheap piece of beef, probably the worst item on the menu.  The restaurant is stuck in a time warp. It is like going into a Chinese restaurant serving Chop Suey. This restaurant is at the same level for Mexican food.
author: Yasmine S.

description: The food is only OK but it is priced like it is very good. The service was good and the atmosphere was fun. We'll probably go back because it is so close and sometimes we just crave mexican food.
author: David T.

description: WOW, this is some decently good Mexican food. Really good Flauta and the Margaritas are great! A good spot to go with a few good friends. Its not too expensive and you get a lot of free chips!
author: Gordon L.

description:
A great place for Mexican food. Please do not mistake this for Tex-Mex. We are talking PACIFIC MEXICAN food. Their margaritas are to die for! My favorite is the Pollo Asada (chicken with spices) and the Gambas (prawns marinated in a garlic, white wine sauce). The portions are huge, so bring your appetite or remember to ask for a doggie bag.

This place has been in business for 40 years. It's a huge local spot. It gets busy, but you can call for reservations. If you have to wait for a table, belly up to the bar, get a margarita, and have fun with your friends.
author: Kimberly R.

description: Two stars for being within walking distance. A much bigger place than I expected and quite frankly, pretty ridiculously impressive for its nondescript exterior. I am well-versed in Mexican food, and although it is hard to beat nearby El Gordo for grab-and-go, this was a nice sit-down meal after a baseball game in the park. I'd have a margarita party here, although I haven't yet samples their version of the concoction. Really really nice service, which can make a decent meal stupedendous.
author: Katie T.

description: Now I know this is not the best mex rex, however, it's in my hood and they do have crazy strong (=good) margaritas. Here is how to make the best of eating at this mediocre mex rex (I mean that in a nice way). Double Margarita (maybe two, hehe), Chile con queso, gambas enchiladas verde with fried egg and re-fried beans. Add great guy, Giants-Phillies on the flat screen....and BOOM, best experience I've had here yet. (Oh, and at initial glance entrees may seem overpriced but wait until you see how much food you get and how bummed you are that you have a 3 block walk i.e. waddle back to your car)
author: Angie M.

description:
MUCHO BUENO This place was love at first sight.  After driving home from a golf outing, we were starving, and my friend Scotty was like, "DUDE lets get some cheese enchi's" (refering to cheese enchilada's) 
 
I was totally down so we decided to stop in.  Right off the bat chips and two types of salsa were in front of us.  Then our waitress came over to our table, and took our margarita orders.  Let me tell you, my Margarita was flat out BOMB, despite giving me heartburn.  They didnt use the sweet and sour mix, but all fresh ingredients in their margies, which was very evident in the taste.  Not only that, but the margaritas were also very strong, so I felt pretty buzzed after just one.  

Getting back to our waitress - she was the sweetest lady in the entire world.  She rememinded me of my grandma, but a a plump, mexican version.

All in all I would highly recommend this place if you are looking for good sit down mexican and bomb margies.  Plus Grandma Forrest works there!
author: Buddy Garrity L.

description: Not a bad place to go. Food is ok, venue is a decent size and the service has always been at par level. The margaritas aren't that bad, but I've had better. It's one of those places you go when you are in the area and want Mexican food.
author: Diana R.

description:
the best margaritas in the city. 

MUST ORDER: the sampler plate. it is enough for three adults. seriously. there's like 4 of everything: two kinds of burritos, empanadas, chicken wings (with soy sauce which was really weird at a mex restaurant but whatever!), quesadillas, etc. 

the salsa is great with the double salted margaritas and Francisco makes it better than anyone else in the joint, with a smile! 

it's never too crowded or too loud and the staff is very nice, especially lucy.
author: Sharonrose B.

description: This is a fun place to go for trivia on the first thursday of every month- be ready for some stiff drinks and even stiffer competition.  The food is pretty good, but after a couple sips of their rockin' margaritas you'll forget why you care.
author: Sarah T.

description: Simple but fun place where you are surrounded by people who are simply out to have a wonderful time. The food was presented well, tasted great and came to us in large portions. I ordered the Chimichanga (artery-clogging at it's best) and it rocked! Everyone sampled each others meals last night and everything was great. Let me also say that their signature Margaritas were one of the best I've ever had. They are prepared the real way without a mix. Simply a great place to relax with friends and have a great meal or to just hang out at the bar...I know now why there are so many "regulars" there.
author: Gabriel R.

description: Mex in the hood.  Some of the best margaritas in SF.  Good Mexican, average service.  A fun Friday night hangout.
author: o o.

description: I went here with coworkers, and though it provided a good after work spot to unwind, the experience wasn't anything memorable.  The food was mediocre; service was okay.  The margaritas were probably the highlight, as they should be at a place called Tia Margarita.  The restaurant's worthy enough for a drink or two (or three or four...), but not much more.
author: Marsha Z.

description: Been here twice and both times have had a great experience.  It certainly isn't the nicest looking place inside, but then again, you aren't there for the decor...  The drinks are reasonably priced (could have a bigger tequila selection, but the put in a good effort).  Food portions are definitely on the large side.  Also, not a bad place for medium sized groups (~10).  If you are in the area, or are looking for a semi-authentic mexican joint to get your drink on check it out.
author: Robert R.

description: My favorite neighborhood restaurant. The decor is from the 70's and it is great. I always feel relaxed and cozy. Margaritas are on the rocks and this is NOT Tex-Mex, this is actually Mexican food, and it's good. Why people keep raving about Tommy's I will never know--let those losers eat there, Tia is the place.
author: C. W.

description: The parking in the area sucks, so just getting to the restaurant is a challenge.  The restaurant is charming and has an old school feel, but the food was pretty mediocre - it is mexican food for people who have never been to mexico.  I'd rather go to any average joint down in the mission.
author: Curtis H.

description: There is nothing like a margarita (double) from Tia! Watch out they are strong!  It's a great comfy and homey restaurant where they know your name.  The food is good, the atmosphere is relaxed and the people are friendly. Always a good bet!
author: Amalia S.

description:
i like it. yes, i do.

in my opinion, better than Tommy's as far as the eats go. not the largest fan of tequila, but everyone i talk to says you still cant get a better margarita than Tommy's.

very nicely done chimichanga here at tia margarita - portions are worth the prices (which dont stray too far from Tommy's). the decor is welcoming, and nice enough, especially the bar, for a date - romantic even when you consider the candles and pretty windows. 

im still stuffed and will now go to sleep.
author: Darrell L.

description: Drank...er...ate here last night for the first time.  The long wait (45 min) for a table for two was occupied by drinking quite possibly the strongest rocks w/salt margarita I've ever had.  I would come back just for the margy, which was made by the most cheerful bartender I've encountered in quite some time.  Unfortunately the chips were a bit stale, but the salsa was tasty and had just the right amount of kick for my taste.  Ordered the Tacos Dorados, (I think...again, the margy) one of each of the chicken and the ground beef.  Both had a nice flavor and the guacamole piled on top tasted fresh.  All in all, a good standby when I'm looking for a fun evening with some tasty food.
author: Kate N.

description: For a city with not many mexican restaurants, this place is a good option. Sometimes shaky on their drink quality and generally the food isn't a letter writer home...but the atmosphere and loud qualities lend itself to a good place to start the weekend. Highly regular crowd, always busy.
author: Jason P.

description: This place was OK. Great chips and salsa, strong margaritas. My enchilada was so-so but I have had some really good enchiladas in SF. My friend from Australia was impressed but as a Mexican food lover, I wasn't too excited. I would even say that I prefer a Chevy's enchilada. I would go there again for the atmosphere, but I wasn't blown away by the food.
author: Emily W.

description: Great Mexican Food.  Some of my favorites are the pollo asada and the chicken tacos.  The service varies, but is overall average.
author: Jessica B.

description: Great, affordable neighborhood place for those weeknights that you don't feel like cooking at home.  These nice people will take care of you and feed you well!
author: Debbie F.

description: First time a charm.   After waiting at Tommy's for a half hour (and I hate going to Tommy's and should know better) we stumbled upon this place. CROWDED but we were greeted right away and sat down in back right away.  Prices are higher than normal but my food was very good and our service was top notch.  We were so surprised at how attentive our waiter was - it was like he was reading our minds (or maybe he was which is why he got a good tip).  We will definitely go back in which I will update this....
author: J J.

description: This is a great Mexican restaurant.  The margaritas are made from fresh squeezed limes, the chips and salsa are good (not very spicy though), but the dish to have is the Chef's Special, shrimp.  Garlic, wine, shrimp.
author: James D.

description:
this would really be just 2 1/2 stars for me if i could...not good, not bad.  

the good:  the portions are good, not "americanized" mexican food, but pretty standard.  nothing to write home about.  it's also a fun place to have a get together w/a large group of friends...the drinks will keep flowing from the big horseshoe bar and parking is somewhat reasonable.  and the margaritas truly are delicious, esp. if you remember to ask them to make them w/top shelf.

the bad:  the wait is pretty bad, especially on the weekends...also, the past few times i've been here, the wait staff seems to have dwindled down to nothing.  i was there on a saturday night with a packed house and there were probably only 2-3 waitresses circling the restaurant.
author: Janet K.

description:
love the atmosphere, but the service is always so-so.

we had a party of about 15 and the server took a long while to get our drink orders, then deliver them, and finally come back to take our menu orders. (i admit, im a little biased being a server myself, but since i deal with it everyday, i consider myself allowed to critique the service mercilessly.)

once we did get the order down, the food came out super quick so i was happy. too bad the food is never that good though, and the rice may potentially have an entire stick of butter in it, tasting like rice-a-roni. mmm...sf treat?? not here. 

long story short, our bill was a good $400...ouch. and it may sound selfish but they never asked what the occasion was for this gathering, (umm cough cough my 21st bday!? thanks.) and there was no celebration or feeling of gratitude. 

also, being a former carnivore  and recently crossing to the  veggie side...being at a mexican food restaurant surrounded by chicken and steak is MURDEROUS!! but my 'dilla was delish. also...2 double margs on the rocks with salt are definitely a good idea! they were quite tasty, and my favorite part of the evening :)
author: Sarah C.

description:
Classic California Mexican Fair 

Americanized for the gringos back in the 60's-70's 

Offering tasty classic's, nothing real authentic or Earth shattering but a real comfort to eat in a cute SF semi-landmark offering Mexican Comfort Food 

Recommend for nostaligia and for the virgin to Mex food
author: Nick Y.

description: First off, the margarita's at this place are pretty strong, being's that in 1st place place in strength would be Puerto Allegre in the mish. I like the fact that they also offer two different types of salsa with your chips-ie:mild and hot. I ordered the triple combo dinner with the taco/enchilada/tamale deal with the typical sides of beans, salad & rice. Very tasty food indeed with a ice cold Corona to comfort my tummy..!!! A def visit if you are in the richmond district vicinity..! Orale Pues..!
author: Sven S.

description:
I had dinner there tonight with my family.  We had reservation, and they seated us right away (PLUS especially with kids).  They were quick on serving us chips and salsa.  The food was pretty good.  

I'm a bit a surprise that they consider themselves "good place for kids".  If they were kid friendly, they should've been more equipped with high chairs.  Throughout the whole restaurant, I've only saw TWO highchairs.  The hostess said that we will NOT get a highchair during our dinner because it's being used and other customers are waiting for one as well.   She asked if we wanted a booster chair.  I prefer not to use a booster for a 11 month old baby because it's not safe.  The table next to us was using two highchairs, and once they left, they gave one highchair to the table next to us who came after us.  But they never asked me if we still wanted one.  

Another thing to add - our waitress could've been a little bit more friendly and more attentive.  She didn't smile when she first came to our table.  When she took our order, it was very hard to hear what she was saying because it's a fairly noisy restaurant.  She didn't come around to fill our water glasses.  She only came once to ask us how we were doing.  

I've been here a couple of times in the past and this was the worst experience I had.  If it wasn't for the food, I would've given them a lower rating.
author: S K.

description:
Tia Margarita is a true neighborhood joint.  We love to go on Friday nights, sit at the bar and talk to the guys that have been hanging out in the neighborhood since they were kids.  

We love the margaritas and the fajitas as large enough to feed both me and my lady.  The food always looks amazing and the bar and wait staff make us feel at home.  Very cool neighborhood spot
author: greg F.

description:
So here's the thing about this place: there are children everywhere. Everywhere. There must have been at least one child, age 3-5 at every table--some even had two. And they were running around all over the place and their parents were either 1) frazzled or 2) completely oblivious--one clueless dad wandered over to our table to gaze over my friend's shoulder at my friend's menu and then shout options across the room towards his table. Then he left without acknowledging us at all. I'm not mad at him. I feel sorry for him.

It's worth noting that I don't have kids, but I am married and will likely have them soon. It's not that I don't like them. I just didn't want them screaming while I was trying to order my food.

So yeah, the experience kinda sucked. The food's good, though. And the portions are pretty big. Maybe if you were to go on a week night, after all the kids are in bed, it'd get 4 stars.
author: jackie t.

description: Great fresh margaritas and food!  I have been there a few times, and it is very consistent.  Probably my favorite Mexican restaurant in the Richmond.
author: Valerie H.

description: Food was good, price was a little high.  Good for when you want to stay in the neighborhood.
author: Joel M.

description: Bad service to begin with....had to repeatedly ask for everything, including water, napkins, salsa, etc.  And bad food too!!!  We won't ever becoming back here!
author: Lisa R.

description:
If you want a "grease infusion" as my mom calls it, this is definitely the place to go.  i have experienced tia margarita's in both sit-down and take out mode, and i must say i prefer take out. it can get hellishly crowded and noisy, especially near the weekends. some of the wait staff is awesome, others just errr....horrible. they have many vegetarian options, but their refried beans have lard in them so you have to be very careful if you do not eat meat or pork. i have had some difficulties in getting take out orders..mainly that the kitchen does not seem to pay attention to what the wait staff has put up on the order...you get the stuff home only to find that there's refried beans in your "veggie burrito"! they are pretty good about letting you check your food before you take it, so if you have any specific food wants and needs, be very sure you are getting what you ordered.
HOWEVER. they use the most excellent salty cheese (their quesadillas...orgasmic), their portions are ENORMOUS, their rice is amazing, their guacamole really excellent. they can cook up an entire meal and have it boxed and ready for you within 15 minutes, no joke. when i have a hankerin for this place, nothing else will satisfy the craving. i give it a 4 instead of a 5 for the kitchen take-out fuck ups and the high prices, but really, this place is take out heaven.
author: roz A.

description: The service and food are great.  My fiance and I always get the combo plates to share as they are easily large enough for two.
author: Alex E.

description: Tia's is in my hood, and as I love Mexican, I'm always on the look out for a one of those rare neighborhood golden nuggets that, despite the worn out 1970's decor, (and I mean that LITERALLY), nevertheless, has food worth the weird ambiance. I was wrong. This is the restaurant that time forgot. It reminds me of one of those musty smelling places my grandparents would drag me to, and since they had completely lost their sense of taste and smell, they were oblivious to the fact that their favorite hot spot had gotten as long in the tooth as they had.  (Ah memories.)   Drive a little further and get a take out burrito from Gordos. It won't be any better, but at least you won't feel used.
author: r b.

description:
I LOVE the food here. However, I've never had good luck with the service. One waitress, in particular, is not exactly the cream of the crop for waitresses. Once, my boyfriend and I asked that the tip be left to the bus boy instead of her, since he did more for us than she did. 

Whenever we come in to pick up food (we don't bother eating there anymore), the service is slow and it's an unpleasant experience. I never feel welcome and leave wondering why I keep coming back...but then I remember, the food is amazing. That's why I settle for take-out and interact as little as possible with the staff.
author: Nicole C.

description: If you live in the Richmond this is a good place to check out every once in a while or if you are with a big group.  However.........Tia margaritas always overcooks their food, the shrimp is always tough and the steaks and chicken are dried out. also when i go to a Mexican restaurant i want Spanish rice, not white rice cooked with sodium rich chicken broth.
author: daniel a.

description: I only came upon these reviews because I am on the look out for good Mexican sit down restaurants. When I saw 4 and 5 stars I gotta speak up. I had such a misguided meal about 2 years ago that I would never go back. Please tell me if I am being harsh and there is a new cook and bartender now. I am so jonesin for great Mexican that is not a taco joint ( not that I don't love them) just lookin for good tequila and tasty food that is authentic. Hoping I get some feedback on this.
author: dana s.

description: I really like this place.  I'm from Arizona and it's hard to find decent, sit-down mexican food in the city.  The food is pretty damn good, big portions (easy to share), at a great price.  The margaritas are awesome, no mixes here!  Highly recommended!  But, it can be busy on weekend nights so beware.
author: a e.

description:
this is american/mexican done right. big cheap portions, attentive wait/barstaff & double margharita's that will have you seeing surreal spinning poker playing dogs on your bedroom ceiling.

sometimes people go to tia's and end up drunk on margharita's. well. that's good, at least their bellies are full.
author: Lawrence K.

description: Really good Mexican food, great neighborhood restaurant.  Chips and salsa are a great start to the meal.  Gamba's are a must have every time.  Steak Picado is delicious.  The plates here are huge!  Go there hungry, and you will definitely leave satisfied!
author: SanFran A.

description: The margaritas are definitely excellent! The food is pretty good as well, and the service is great. Definitely recommended!
author: L T.

description: One of our favorite hang outs!!  Everyone that works there is fun and friendly.  We love the fresh Margaritas - but be careful, they're stronger than you think!  The food is great - authentic as far as I can tell. Once a month they have trivia games in the bar, a great place to meet people.
author: Meghan S.

description: Great Mexican-American food.  Plates are always consistent and there is a great neighborhood vibe.  I like to sit at the bar and watch sports or people.  Good margaritas made from scratch
author: Darin D.

description:
Four stars, but three star food. It gets four stars because this place delivers what it promises -- classic over-Americanized Mexicanish food paired with cheap drinks.

Contrary to what others say, it doesn't matter what you order.  Everything you get will be smothered in cheese and taste vaguely of lard.  Besides, you'll be drunk by the time the food comes.  The food tastes good, but how could it not when it's smothered in cheese? If you must pick a particular item, I recommend the flauta.  It's huge and covered in sour cream and guacamole, not to mention that it's a deep fried flauta.

The drinks are awesome here.  The margaritas are great, like everyone says. It's not like that crud they serve you at Chevy's that is filled with crushed ice and no tequila.  However, the house wine is a cheaper option if you are a creep like me.  For $10.50, you get a liter of wine.  Drink it up.

Now, the service.  I almost dropped it down a star.  There's this one old lady waitress who's always there, and she sucks.  She moves slower than you can believe.  The real problem is that she is pure evil.  If you ask her a question that she doesn't want to answer, she ignores it. My friend literally asked "Do you have Carnitas?" five times before awkwardly giving up on getting an answer.  Strangely, however, she actually met our service needs.  I think the alcohol makes me less angry.
author: Dean A.

description: The food is ordinary but the margaritas are great and the bartender is cute.  Also, I like the ambience.  You feel like your in the suburbs - children, married couples with bellies, ordinary-looking guys and the low prices!  This place is awesome when you don't want to be a "poser".
author: V T.

description: I've been here a couple of times. Each time has been great. The service is up beat and friendly. Their chips and salsa are super addicting. I will have to say they have some pretty tasty margaritas. The food has always been hot and tasty. No complaints about this place. Great neighborhood joint
author: Cortney H.

description: HANDS DOWN MY FAVORITE RESTAURANT!!!  Great food killer drinks and awesome environment! We try to go at least once a week!......whats really great is that I am a vegetarian and they have a great tostado salad for me. And they are happy to modify and meal for me. CHeck it out kids...you wont be disappointed
author: tracy d.

description: I am in total and complete agreement with Kyky A. The Tia's margaritas have become my standard to judge others by. NO NASTY MIXERS! I almost feel sorry for the bartender hand-pressing those buckets of limes. It is the real deal; no sissy lala margarita wannabees here. The before-mentioned family vibe is a result some 40 plus years of attracting the local and not quite so local neighborhood patrons. We keep coming back for those big (and I mean BIG) plates of yummy mexican comfort food. Yes, parking does suck but what else is new in SF; just plan ahead. Having read less than praiseful reviews, one just concludes "to each, his own"... one less patron means one more seat at the bar for me!
author: Dorte R.

description: The chips and salsa are amazing and I always crave the food for days after dining there. The only down side to this place is I can never find parking.
author: K. D.

description: The guac was the best part of the meal and would have been better if the chips wern't stale.  The restaurant ambiance was nice and cozy.  Very minimalistic decorating.  What was also nice was that every seat in the front room was a booth.  We didn't see the back room.  The front room is half bar and half booth seating.  The margaritas were a bit too tequilla-strong (meaning... all tequilla) in my book, but my gf says they were ok.  The food was bland and not much flavor.  I told the waitress this and sent my dish back, they countered with "Thats how authentic mexican tastes."  I guess I was just accustomed to more flavor.  But they did comp my plate, which was nice.  I'd be willing to give it a second chance, but not anytime soon.
author: steve m.

description:
OK, I love Mexican food.  To me, beans + rice are my comfort food; for others, it's macaroni and cheese.  And I've eaten a lot of Mexi food, so I know what's delicious, good, decent, bad, terrible, etc.  

I've dined here twice, with two different people and none of us liked the food.  I hate to say it but Tia Margarita's food falls in the terrible mark.   :(  I really really want to like the food here, let alone LOVE it., but it's just not good.   

I'll break it down for you:

Food: definitely not traditional mexican, flavorless, gringo-style, not a lot of vegetarian options either. The food reminded me of what you'd get at the Alcapulco chain.

Atmosphere: cozy, hasn't changed since the 70s, neighborhoody- love it!

Service: just ok

Margaritas: good

Chips and salsa: quite tasty

Bottom line: Go here for drinks and chips and salsa. Skip the food.

Please someone... open a decent Mexican restaurant in the Richmond!
author: A M.

description: the mission has nothing on this mexican restaurant. its the best in SF. its soooo authentic-- wait till you see the decor. its hard to describe but you feel like you're really in mexico. the margaritas are made the "real way", not with a mix. all lime and tequila-- strong but yummy. oh, and the food. huge plates, prepared perfectly. you'll leave very full, a bit tipsy-- but very happy!
author: Michelle I.

description: We rarely eat mexican food outside of the Mish, but found a parking spot on this rainy cold evening. Arrived here expecting the usual mediocre dinner at the restaurant, but were truly astonished that they were capable of producing even less desirable food.The salsa is obviously bottled ala La victoria, the taco shells are purchased pre packaged shells that you can buy at your local supermarket.  The food was so bland, no spices, no flavor, not even a piece of onion on the plate.  You could puree the entire dinner and sell it as baby food it was so bland. The patrons who eat here must be totally clueless as to what good mexican food should taste like, or are so drunk on the  margaritas, that they don't care what the food tastes like.It is easily 35% higher in prices that you can find elsewhere in the city.  On the plus side, good service and good strong margaritas.  We will never ever eat there again.  Save your money.
author: stephanie m.

description: if this place wasnt walking distance i would not seek it out. dont get me wrong - the margaritas and bartenders are fantastic!  the female servers are horrible (speaking of two in particular)  They bluntly rush you to order, eat and get the hell out. (even when they are not busy) I even made a comment last time I was there "dont worry, I'm trying to get out asap" - didnt seem to bother her in the least.  So...note to self and others...if you're looking for a good margarita and need some "so-so" mexican food to balance out booze - sit at the bar....
author: c m.

description: have you ever eaten mexican food in texas? if you have, you are a) lucky, and b) probably have type 2 diabetes now. they don't fork around with their serving sizes and the amount of cheese on the crud or tequila in the drink. this is definitely what i look for in a sit-down mexican eatery (i.e., not a taqueria). do not bring me dainty! and so far, tia margarita is the closest thing in SF to texas-style mexican restaurants. extra point for the name; texas law states that mexican restaurant names must be a two-word phrase in Spanish, easily decipherable by a Bush voter (see Amigos, Dos and Casa, La).
author: Shannon V.

description: I first went to this place back in the 70's and haven't been back for the last ten years or so.  I returned twice in the past month and absolutely enjoyed it.  It's fun, not pretentious, a real San Francisco neighborhood gem.  The food was great and staff tried very hard to please.  I'll be back again real soon!
author: Jan O.

description: i've been coming here for the past 5 years... and i heart this place! my favorites are the chicken enchiladas and the gambas burritos, always served on wickedly hot plates. (watch out). the most addictive thing is the salsa! i wish they would sell their salsa. don't forget about the margaritas... tasty and strong. the restaurant is a neighborhood favorite and richmond folks hope that the secret will never be leaked out.
author: bo t.

description: First time diner...loved the interior but the love stops there.  Simple enchilada plate was a disappointment.  Tasted like boiled hospital food with no flavor.  Rice was yellow like it had saffron - not the traditional mexican rice.  Refries were poor and overdone - should be called reburns. Maybe I could have filled up on chips but the salsa was terrible as if it was cut with tomato sauce.  Service was underwhelming as well.
author: Tom O.

description: This is definitely a fun place, especially for big group dinners, though you can also just stop in for drinks since the bar in the front is quite large and cozy and does a respectable business on its own.  The food here is authentic, which can be good or bad--depending on what you like.  It's very tasty--rich sauces and lots of melted cheese--but is also kinda flat and greasy and not terribly healthy.  It's probably not a bad idea to get a salad with your dinner...if you have room.  The portions are certainly generous, and the fresh salsas that come with the complimentary tortillas are really good.  The main attraction, however, is not the food but the margaritas, which are available in a "double" size if you're in a hurry to summon up a pleasantly euphoric state of mind.  They are definitely very good, too--and I'm not at all a tequila fan.  As Michelle mentioned, the decor is definitely a step apart from anywhere else I've been in the city...I seem to recall vaulted ceilings, plenty of dark wood, medieval-looking chandeliers, and stained glass.  Somehow it all feels more festive than a Catholic church, which I'm realizing is what I've just described--just go and check it out yourself, and get one blended with salt on the rim.
author: Michael T.

description: S wanted mexican food, and we all wanted a place with a waiter, instead of having the food behind a counter like most of the places in mission, so we decided to try here. it was saturday, but a weird time, 4 something. at this time, it was predicably dead. you walk in, and it's a bar ish area, and in the back is more restauranty style seating. we sat in back. the whole place looked weird. like a place for old people, or a cheap howard johnsons add on, or some only restaurant in the middle of nowhere if youve been driving forever and come upon a small town. i dont know, just disused and out of date. maybe when its full, it doesnt seem that way. salsa was not spicy, but it was good. we filled up way too much on those chips. s also ordered nachos which they all ate. but i dont like nachos. when the food finally came (it took a lil while...) it was very large portions, so thats good. they have combos with 2 or 3 items. i got the 2 items, which filled me up, so you know its big. a beef burito and a regular chicken enchilada. the yellow rice was tasty. the food was average, kinda meh. b got a sausage egg thing. he didnt eat much of it but said it was ok. s and j got the 3 combos. they had enchiladas, tacos, rellenos. it was too much for them after the apps. so have a big appetite if you order that. the food was eh. i tried the leftovers. s didnt like his really at all. except the rice. the waitress was nice about making changes to j's food. the worst part was the water. water came in TINY glasses. filled too far with ice. and i was thirsty. i didnt drink that day yet... and i had to keep asking a billion times for my glass to be refilled. after begging and begging i'd get a cup. and drink it in 2 sips. then sit there and start begging all over again. its water, its free, dont be stingy! im drinking it, its not being wasted! i was parched the whole meal. so, overall, a meh place. id not drive out here to go again. if i lived around the corner, hmm i still dont think id go back. other better looking restaurants around. it just didnt impress me.
author: Merredith L.

description: ive been going to this place for years and im still not tired of it. the inside has a fun atmosphere good for anything from a date to a family dinner to a night out with the friends. this place has one of the best margaritas ive ever had and it is really nice that they keep bringing you chips and salsa no matter how many you eat. i love the portion sizes and the service is satisfactory. only problem is the place can get a bit loud on a busy night.
author: Andrew D.

description: Excellent Margaritas but the Carne Asada was tough and overcooked.  I've been a here a few times and my friends and I were thinking about checking out another overrated Mexican joint in the area, Tommy's, but didn't want to deal with the ruckus there.  In the same neighborhood, Tia Margarita is a nicer layout, and a little more upscale but with similar prices.  The margaritas are second only to Tres Agaves, but the food is hit and miss.  I've ordered the garlic shrimp in the past, and have loved it, but I went for red meat and was left a little disappointed.  The service is middle ground, but they don't pull the margaritas out of pitcher, and you have to wait for each one to be individually blended.  My friend Dave noted that behind the bar was a cluster of American Flags which was a first for me to see in a Mexican restaurant with out the flag of Mexico in site.  I mean, I'm sure it doesn't mean anything, but it led to an interesting and fun conversation.  After eating at Tia, it is routine to go to Trad'r Sam's afterwards and watch people get shit faced.
author: Adam M.

description: It just isn't that good.  the food was acceptable.  the service was average, nothing bad, but nothing good either, and the margarita was not so good at all.  for the price and even in this neighborhood, there are better Mexican joints.
author: andrew p.

description: I love Tia's!  My husband and I are there at least once a week for the margaritas, yummy food and great service!  Tia's has some of the best mexican food in SF!
author: ann l.

description: Best margaritas in the city, great service, fun place.  Get the chef's special!
author: Vito M.

description: i really like this place for some reason.  The environment is Chi Chi's Mexican restaurant a la 1993.  Needless to say, it struck a chord with me.  The food was good - above average, but not on par with the elite places, especially in San Fran.  The drinks were super good.  Really stiff margarita (not really much more than a beer, scotch or gin drinker).  The service was super good and everything came out very fast.  Tried the chicken taco and enchilada - good, but not worth 12 bucks.  Beans and rice were...well...beans and rice.  Never been able to tell the difference no matter where I go.
author: Sanjiv B.

description: If a margarita is what you seek and your in Richmond, not a bad place to be. If you want to eat, skip it. Too much cheese, weak(ish) chips and average salsa means this place will remind you more of Chi Chi's then you care to remember. The staff is perfect, nice, lovely people. The food would benefit from some foreign aid anywhere South of County line.
author: Dave C.

description: This place is great.  The food is outstanding and enormously plentiful.  The atmosphere is really a a little piece of Mexican/European Heaven in the Richmond.  The food is great, service is great, salsa is wonderful, the portions are enormous!!  Try to get a waitress named SAndra.  She is amazing. WE have had her wait on us twice. She constantly checks to make sure everything is okay.. is really attentive to more chips, drinks, salsa, etc... and most importantly, if you have a kid, she is amazing with them and can defuse any toddler situation imaginable in a second, making the dining experience even more pleasant for the parents.The bartender who I can only distinguish by the fact that he is BAsque is awesome.  There's another awesome latin American server who rocks and remembers us every time and is gracious and courteous.  There's a couple of employees that seem a little grumpy but- achh.. we avoid them. This place is great. Great value, good food, friendly people.   If they are not too booked, you should ask to be seated in one of Sandra's (lovely Irish lass') table.
author: joanne g.

description: Although horrible, it was probably the funniest experiences ever. All I have to say is the waitress brought us our beers long after we ordered them and said "I forgot them on the counter, hope they're still cold" (chuckle) while plopping them down on our table. I couldn't help but laugh out loud. Very awkward and uncomfortable. Food.....lets just say I should of made a trip to La Taqueria in the mission if I wanted some good mexican. 2 stars for the laughing we did pertaining the food and service.
author: Diana D.

description: our abuelita server was coolbean and we had some yummie food...  it felt pretty cozy and kinda like we were visiting the old lady's place for dinner... :)
author: charlotte s.

description: we stumbled on to this place after tommy's was closed (on a tuesday!!) and i have to say that we were very happy. the marg's were great, all of our food was excellent. they had good chips which i think is extremely important. good gauc, salsa and chimi's. we loved it and can' t wait to go back!
author: Jenifer B.

description: Tia Margarita or the Rita as my friends call it, has the best double strawberry margarita.  The service can be rude at times, but after a couple of margarita's it does really matter.
author: vikki a.

description: Okay, here's my two-cents worth (actually $12.50 plus tax).  Someone mentioned "comfort food," and they're right on the money!  This place is something of an iconic holdover from another era, namely its founding date of 1964.  If you happen to have a special place in your heart for fairly homogenous California Mexican "cuisine" (I hesitate a little to use such a dignified term), then Tia delivers the goods in a goodly fashion.  Someone mentioned the chicken breast asada, which I think is really one of their signature dishes.  Someone else mentioned the gambas (prawns) in garlic and butter, which is quite how I remember the dish being served in Mexican coastal towns.  I enjoy both of these preparations very much and am partial to their salsa verde (tomatillo sauce) enchiladas as well.  For me, Tia does a nice job of satisfying the need for a neighborhood comfort-style restaurant.  As for quality, two comments:  First, the margaritas are disappointing in ways previously mentioned.  The most egregious is that they have NO 100% agave tequilas from which to make a premium drink (remember, Tia resides in a time warp!).  If you happen to live in the present, you have little choice but to cap your meal off with a walk down to Tommy's for a properly composed margarita.  My second observation about quality is that I suffered through some pretty bad meals at Tia Margarita during 2007 and into 2008.  Most notably food tended toward the salty and soggy, and there were other problems, too.  Then, sometime around mid-year everything got noticeably better.  The food quality has remained consistently up-to-par for the past six or eight months, so I guess it's not a fluke.  They must have fired the cook, and now I needn't apologize to anyone--especially myself--for enjoying the fare.  One tip:  There are some wacky (hard of hearing?  inattentive? distracted?) older waitresses who serve the dining rooms.  I suppose one could say these servers are charming in their own way, but for my money I prefer the gracious and attentive food service Antonio provides in the lounge.  Enjoy!
author: Ron L.

description: Mediocre, at best. The portions are generous, the service was so-so. Seeing that it was my first time there, the no-nonsense waitress asked, "Something to drink for you?" And I'd just been seated at the table so I just replied, "I'll just have water for now." The waitress snapped back as if I didn't understand the question, "Something to drink from the BAR?" I said again, "No thanks, maybe later, just water." She looks blankly at me and then moves on to take another beverage order. I'm not asking to be patronized here but seriously, cold service does not encourage me to return to the restaurant. As dinner went on, she seemed much more polite and attentive but the food was just okay, it lacked bold flavors that I'm used to with Mexican food. One thing I thought was a little bit strange was that she took the time to take our orders 20 minutes before the rest of our party arrived. After they got there, they ordered, but they got their food first. What the...?
author: Monica N.

description: love love love this place. my boyfriend and i both love this place and go here anytime we go into the city.  we love the atmosphere-it has a cool margarita bar, the place is decorated nicely, and its kinda cozy and romantic.  the prices are great and the food is even better. the only bad thing is parking kinda sucks- it sucks anywhere in the richmond district. but the place is well worth it.
author: Renee S.

description: Tias has hands down the best margaritas (Silver Herradura on the rocks with salt) in this city! I love the atmosphere and also love the food. Always ask for a side of Gambas dressing to go with anything you order. Delicious!
author: M. T.

description: I love this place!  Apart from the crappy parking, the food was great, the atmosphere was really nice, love the margarita bar and the prices were really good!
author: Karen B.

description: Above average food, great margaritas, spotty service. One of my favorite hangouts in one of my many old naighborhoods. Parking's a bitch.
author: Matt G.

description: The food here can not be beat.  We had the quesadilla with carne asada which was so great.  The dough was like philo dough.  So good.  We also had the burrito with carne asada.  We had a margarita (single shot) and we spent $35.
author: Brian L.

description: There was a time I would have given this place four or five stars but the quality of their food has deteriorated sadly over the last year or so. I had dinner there this past weekend and out of our party of five, three of us had tamales. They were nasty. Beyond nasty, actually. They were downright disgusting. They were supposed to be beef but they looked more as though they were filled with something trapped (and slaughtered) in the kitchen. Service here is usually okay but avoid -at all cost - the ditzy old lady who still waits tables, although she should have laid down her order pad 20 years ago. She is rude and invariably screws up at least  one order in  your party. No lie. You can count on it. Another caveat - the noise factor is quite an issue. Don't go there expecting a quiet dinner for two. Uh-uh. Besides the crowd at the bar (who get rather boisterous after a few belts and there's some sports show on the TV) there are always the stalwart parents who insist on bringing their screaming offspring with them. If this wasn't enough, parking in that neighborhood is a complete pain in the ass. Do yourself a favor and skip this joint.
author: Owen H.

description: Good spot for reasonably priced sit down Mexican food and good for a group.  The margarita's are pretty good and the service was attentive.
author: Glen E.

description: Just what you want for a fun, mexican restaurant.  I had a birthday gathering here and our waitress was this older woman who was all business.  She wouldn't let my friend leave without bringing his burrito home and she brought us ice cream with a candle in it to have with our cupcakes!  It was so sweet.  The food was exactly what you'd expect, huge servings of yummy mexican food and unlimited chips and salsa.
author: L P.

description: Been going here twice/month for 20 years.  Great food, great margaritas, great friendly service.  Try Jenny's Special if you want to eat light.......
author: Scott W. W.

description: On Cinco de Mayo; I had a party of 9 join me for a get together in the afternoon around 4. I had called earlier to ask if they needed me to make a reservation since we had a huge group joining me. The response was no it is not needed today... We arrived and ordered a round of drinks and appetizers. You would hope the staff would appreciate having us there as we would have ordered more as time went on, but out of the blue; a lady drops by our table and mentions that the seating is for people ordering dinner and not just casual get togethers. I was appalled besides being angry! The restaurant personnel didn't think or care that we would have spent $$ if they didn't inform us that we need to leave their establishment. We were not loud or behaving inappropriately, but now realize they did not appreciate us or want our business. I will never return here again or recommend this establishment to any one. Management needs to think carefully it is customers, who save your place or let it close.... Maybe next time you will think how you need to treat your customers!!!
author: n w.

description: mediocre mexican food for normal-semi expensive prices. you probably wont be blown away by the food here, but you wont leave saying you hated it. if you get the plate with the burrito and something else, you will get a full burrito and a meal. something to take home, that's a good deal. deal.
author: Wats C.

description: numero uno!!!! these guys rock. i swear i have never wanted to eat salsa with just a spoon before but here it's just so freakin' yummy. my husband and i have been going here for the past 3 years and we adore everything about this place. great service, tasty margarita and tasty tasty food.
author: erin f.

description: This margarita haven, lighting up the corner with its neon "Tia" sign, is home to those who are looking for a little "Cheers" action; imagine Sam yelling "[insert name here]," as you nudge open the door. Sidle up to a bar stool, throw a welcoming grin to the locals seated on each side and gain eye contact with bartender Jennie for one of her "heavy on the top shelf tequila" margaritas. It's all love in the glass as she pushes a concoction of fresh lime juice and tequila your way. Simple and tart, this potion will throw any other margarita this side of the Mississippi under the bus. Order up the Jennie's Special, chow down on the infamous salsa and watch this Clement hideaway come alive. If you're looking for a little "me time," this isn't the place for you--regulars love to start up conversation and you'll be obliged to at least  give a few short answers. Jennie's margaritas may be strong, so if you're looking for a little hand holding, I suggest the kiddie slide at Chucky Cheese. It's a family affair so patience is always appreciated.
author: adria h.
